en: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
hmr: Adam, Seth, Enos;

en: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
hmr: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared;

en: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
hmr: Enok, Methusela, Lamek;

en: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
hmr: Noa, Sem, Ham le Japheth.

en: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
hmr: Japheth naupasalhai chu; Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Mesek le Tira an nih.

en: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, and Diphath, and Togarmah.
hmr: Gomer naupasalhai chu: Aske- naz, Diphath le Togarma an nih.

en: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
hmr: Javan naupasalhai chu: Elisa, Tarsis, Kittim le Rodanim an nih.

en: The sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
hmr: Ham naupasalhai chu: Kus, Mizraim, Put le Kanaan an nih.

en: And the sons of Cush: Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raama, and Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba, and Dedan.
hmr: Chun, Kus naupasalhai chu: Seba, Havila, Sabta, Raama le Sabteka an nih. Raama naupasalhai chu: Seba le Dedan an nih.

en: And Cush begat Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
hmr: Kus chun Nimrod a nei a; hnuoia thilthawtheitak a hung ni ṭan tah a.

en: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
hmr: Chun, Mizraim chun Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

en: and Pathrusim, and Casluhim (from whence came the Philistines), and Caphtorim.
hmr: Pathrusim, Kasluhim (Philistin mihai hung suokna chu) le Kaph- torim a nei a.

en: And Canaan begat Sidon his first-born, and Heth,
hmr: Chun, Kanaan chun a nau lutirah Zidon a nei a, chun, Heth;

en: and the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,
hmr: Chun, Jebus mihai, Amor mihai, Girgas mihai;

en: and the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
hmr: Hiv mihai, Ark mihai, Sin mihai;

en: and the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
hmr: Arvad mihai, Zemar mihai le Hamath mihai a nei a.

en: The sons of Shem: Elam, and Asshur, and Arpachshad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.
hmr: Sem naupasalhai chu: Elam, Assur, Arpaksad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether le Mesek an nih.

en: And Arpachshad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.
hmr: Arpaksad chun Sela a nei a, Sela chun Eber a nei a.

en: And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
hmr: Eber-a chun naupasal pahni an pieng a: a pakhat hming chu Peleg a nih; ama hun lai chun hnuoi hi ṭhein a um sih a; chun, a unaupa hming chu Joktan a nih.

en: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
hmr: Joktan chun Almodad, Seleph, Hazarmaveth, Jera;

en: and Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
hmr: Hadoram, Uzal, Dikla;

en: and Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
hmr: Ebal, Abimael, Seba;

en: and Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
hmr: Ophir, Havila le Jobab a nei a. Hienghai po po hi Joktan naupasal- hai chu an nih.

en: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,
hmr: Sem, Arpaksad, Sela,

en: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
hmr: Eber, Peleg, Reu;

en: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
hmr: Serug, Nahor, Tera,

en: Abram (the same is Abraham).
hmr: Abram, (hi hi Abraham leh thu- hmun a nih);

en: The sons of Abraham: Isaac, and Ishmael.
hmr: Abraham naupasalhai chu Isak le Ismael.

en: These are their generations: the first-born of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
hmr: Hi hi an inthla dân chu a nih. Ismael nau lutîr chu Nebaioth a na; chun, Kedar hai, Adbeel hai, Mibsam hai;

en: Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,
hmr: Misma hai, Duma hai, Massa hai, Hadad hai, Tema hai,

en: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
hmr: Jetur hai, Naphis hai, Kedema hai. Hienghai hi Ismael naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: And the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bare Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan: Sheba, and Dedan.
hmr: Chun, Abraham thaikêm Ke- tura naupasalhai chu: Zimran le, Joksan le, Medan le, Midian le, Isbak le Sua an nih. Chun, Joksan naupa- salhai chu: Seba, Dedan.

en: And the sons of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
hmr: Chun, Midian naupasalhai chu; Epha, Epher, Hanok, Abida, Eldaa an nih. Hieng po po hi Ketura naupa- salhai chu an nih.

en: And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau, and Israel.
hmr: Chun, Abraham chun Isak a nei a; Isak naupasalhai chu: Esau le Israel.

en: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.
hmr: Esau naupasalhai chu: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeus, Jalam le Kora.

en: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.
hmr: Eliphaz naupasalhai chu: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna le Amalek,

en: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
hmr: Reuel naupasalhai chu: Na- hath, Zera, Samma le Mizza.

en: And the sons of Seir: Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.
hmr: Chun, Seir naupasalhai chu: Lotan, Sobal, Zibeon, Ana, Dison, Ezer le Disan.

en: And the sons of Lotan: Hori, and Homam; and Timna was Lotan’s sister.
hmr: Chun, Lotan naupasalhai chu: Hori le Homam. Timna chu Lotan farnu a nih.

en: The sons of Shobal: Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon: Aiah, and Anah.
hmr: Sobal naupasalhai chu: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Sephi le Onam. Chun, Zibeon naupasalhai chu: Aia le Ana.

en: The sons of Anah: Dishon. And the sons of Dishon: Hamran, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
hmr: Ana naupasal chu Dison. Dison naupasalhai chu: Hamran, Esban, Ithran le Keran.

en: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, and Zaavan, Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz, and Aran.
hmr: Ezer naupasalhai chu: Bilhan, Zaavan le Jaakan. Disan naupasalhai chu: Uz le Aran.

en: Now these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
hmr: Tuhin hienghai hi Edom ram- a lal rorêltuhai chu an nih, chu hmaa Israel thlahai chunga lal rorêltuhai chu: Bela, Beor naupa; a khawpui hming chu Dinhaba a nih.

en: And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
hmr: Bela chu a thih a, Bozra-a Zera naupa Jobab chun ama aiin ro a rêl a.

en: And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Jobab chu a thih a, ama aia chun Teman mihai rama um Husam chun ro a rêl a.

en: And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Avith.
hmr: Chun, Husam chu a thih a, ama aia chun Bedad naupa Hadad, Moab phaia Midianhai hnetu khan ro a rêl a; chun, a khawpui hming chu Avith a ni nghe ngheh a.

en: And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Hadad chu a hung thih a, ama aia chun Masrekaa um Samla chun ro a rêl a.

en: And Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Samla chu a thih a, ama aia chun Vadungpui panga Reho- botha um Saul chun ro a rêl a.

en: And Shaul died, and Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Saul chu a hung thih a, ama aia chun Akbor naupa Baal-hanan chun ro a rêl a.

en: And Baal-hanan died, and Hadad reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Pai: and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.
hmr: Chun, Baal-hanan chu a thih a, ama aia chun Hadadin ro a rêl a; a khawpui hming chu Pai a nih; chun, a nuhmei hming chu Mehetabel a na, ama chu Mezahab naunu, Matred naunu a nih.

en: And Hadad died. And the chiefs of Edom were: chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,
hmr: Chun, Hadad chu a thi a. Chun, Edom ram awptuhai chu: Timna, Alia, Jetheth,

en: chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
hmr: Oholibama, Ela, Pinon,

en: chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
hmr: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,

en: chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.
hmr: Magdiel le Iram hai an nih. Hienghai hi Edom ram awptuhai chu an nih.

en: Now the Philistines fought against Israel: and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chun Israelhai chu an hung do a, chuongchun, Israel mihai chu Philis- tin mihai hmaa inthawk chun an tlânsieh a, Gilboa tlânga dâm chun anni chu thatin an tlu tâwl a.

en: And the Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chun Saula le a naupasalhai chu nasatakin an hnawt a; chuongchun, Philistin mi- hai chun Saula naupasal Jonathan le Abinadab le Malkisua chu anthat a.

en: And the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was distressed by reason of the archers.
hmr: Chun, Saula chunga chun indona chu a hung zuol ta hle el a, thal kâp mihai chun ama chu an nangchîng tah a; thal kâp mihai lei chun nasatakin a beidawng tah a.

en: Then said Saul unto his armor-bearer, Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith, lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me. But his armor-bearer would not; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took his sword, and fell upon it.
hmr: Chun, Saula chun a râlthuom chawitu kuoma chun, “I kâwlhnâm kha phawi la, mi hung sunthleng el rawh; chuong naw chun, hieng sertan lohai hi hung an ta, mi hung sukbuoi rawi an tih,” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, a râlthuom chawitu chu a nuom nawh a, ama chu a ṭi êm êm leiin. Chuleiin, Saula chun a kâwlhnâm chu a lâk a, a baw lût tah a.

en: And when his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell upon his sword, and died.
hmr: Chun, a râlthuom chawitu chun Saula chu a thi tah ti a hmu chun, ama khawm chu a kâwlhnâm chu a baw lût a, a thi ve tah a.

en: So Saul died, and his three sons; and all his house died together.
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chu a thi tah a, a naupasal pathumhai leh; an sûngkuo chu an rêngin hmunkhata chun an thi tah a.

en: And when all the men of Israel that were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook their cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
hmr: Chun, ruoma um Israel mihai po po chu an tlânseh a, Saula le a naupa- salhai chu an thi ti an hriet phing chun an khuohai chu an tlânsan a, an tlânse ve tah a; chuongchun, Philistin mihai chu an hung a, chuongahai chun an hung chêng tah a.

en: And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.
hmr: Chun, a zînga Philistin mihaiin an râl thathai thuom chu hlîp dinga an hung chun Saula le a naupasalhai chu Gilboa tlânga chun an lo tlu ve zing ti an hmu tah a.

en: And they stripped him, and took his head, and his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry the tidings unto their idols, and to the people.
hmr: Ama chu a thuom an hlîp a, a lu chu an lâk a, a râlthuom leh, mipuihai le an milimhai kuoma chanchin intlun dingin Philistin rama chun an thawn vêl tah a.

en: And they put his armor in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the house of Dagon.
hmr: Chuongchun, a râlthuomhai chu an pathienhai ina chun an sieh a, a lu chu Dagon ina chun an târ a.

en: And when all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
hmr: Chun, Jabes-gilead mihai po po chun Saula chunga Philistin mihai thilthaw po po chu an hrietin,

en: all the valiant men arose, and took away the body of Saul, and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
hmr: mi hrât huoisenhai po po chu an tho a, Saula ruong le a naupasalhai ruonghai chu an lâk hmang a, Jabes-a chun an hung lâk a, Jabes- a thingsaisuo hnuoiah an ruhai chu an phûm a, ni sari sûng bu an nghei a.

en: So Saul died for his trespass which he committed against Jehovah, because of the word of Jehovah, which he kept not; and also for that he asked counsel of one that had a familiar spirit, to inquire thereby,
hmr: Chuongchun, Saula chu LALPA chunga a ringum nawna leiin a thi tah a; LALPA thu chu a zâwm nawh a, khawhri zâwl aisânthiem chu zawng suokin a râwn a,

en: and inquired not of Jehovah: therefore he slew him, and turned the kingdom unto David the son of Jesse.
hmr: LALPA chu a râwn naw a nih. Chuongchun, LALPA chun ama chu a sukhlum a, a ram chu Jesai naupa David kuoma pêk a ni tah.

en: Then all Israel gathered themselves to David unto Hebron, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai po po chu David kuomah Hebrona chun an hung inkhâwm a, “Ngai ta, i ru le i tisahai kan ni hi.

en: In times past, even when Saul was king, it was thou that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and Jehovah thy God said unto thee, Thou shalt be shepherd of my people Israel, and thou shalt be prince over my people Israel.
hmr: Kha hmaa Saula lal a ni lai khawm khan, nangin i mi keihruoi a, Israel rama hin i mi hung lûtpui a na, LALPA i Pathien chun i kuomah, ‘Ka mi Israelhai chu châwm i ta, ka mi Israelhai chunga chun lal nîng i tih,’ a ti kha,” an ta.

en: So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before Jehovah; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of Jehovah by Samuel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel upahai po po chu Hebronah lal kuoma chun an hung a, David chun LALPA hmaah Hebrona chun anni le chun thuthlung a siem tah a; Samuel kuta LALPA thu ang peiin David chu Israel lal ni dingin hriek an nâl tah a.

en: And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (the same is Jebus); and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.
hmr: Chun, David le Israel mihai po po chu Jerusalemah an hang feh a (chu chu Jebus a nih); chun, Jebus mihai, a rama chênghai chu chutaka chun an um a.

en: And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, Thou shalt not come in hither. Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion; the same is the city of David.
hmr: Jebusa chênghai chun David kuomah, “Hitaka hin i hung lût ding a ni nawh,” an lo tih a. Nisienla- khawm, David chun Zion kul chu a lâk a; chu chu David khawpui a hung ni tah a.

en: And David said, Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. And Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was made chief.
hmr: David chun, “Tukhawm Jebus mi that hmasataktu chu sipai hotu tak nîng a tih,” a ta. Chun, Zeruia naupa Joab chu a hmasatak a na, chuong- chun, hotua siem a ni tah a.

en: And David dwelt in the stronghold; therefore they called it the city of David.
hmr: Chun, David chu kula chun a chêng tah a; chuleichun, David khaw- pui an ti tah a.

en: And he built the city round about, from Millo even round about; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
hmr: Chun, khawpui chu Millo le a vêl po po chu a vêlin a bâwl a; chun, Joab chun a la bâkhai chu a siemṭha bawk a.

en: And David waxed greater and greater; for Jehovah of hosts was with him.
hmr: Chun, David chu a hung ropui deu deu a, sipaihai LALPA chu a kuomah a um sih a.

en: Now these are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of Jehovah concerning Israel.
hmr: Chun, hienghai hi sipai huoisen bîkhai Davidin a nei, Israel chung- thua LALPA thu ang peia ama lala siem dinga Israel mihai po po inkawpa, a ram sûnga ama le hrâta insuklanghai chu an nih.

en: And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them at one time.
hmr: Hieng hi mi thilthawthei David- in a nei chu an nih: Hakmon thlaa mi Jasobeam, sâwmthum chunga hotu; mi za thum chungah a fei ân let a, kâr loin anni chu a that tâwl tah a.

en: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
hmr: Chun, ama hnunga chun Aho mi, Dodo naupa Eleazar, mi thilthaw- thei pathumhai laia pakhat chu a nih.

en: He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where was a plot of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.
hmr: Pasdammima khan David kuomah a um a, chu hmuna chun Philistin mihai chu indo dingin an inkhâwm a, chutaka chun, hmun, buṭeia sip a um a; mipuihai chu Philistin mihai hmaa chun an tlân- seh a.

en: And they stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and slew the Philistines; and Jehovah saved them by a great victory.
hmr: Chun, chu bu hmun lailung laia chun an ngîr a, an hum tlat tah a; Philistin mihai chu an that a, LALPA chun hnena ropuitakin anni chu a sanhim a.

en: And three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the host of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
hmr: Chun, sipai sâwmthumhai chu lungpuiah, David kuomah, Adullam pûka chun an va feh a; chun, Philistin sipaihai chu Rephaim ruoma chun ruongchaichea thlâkin an um a.

en: And David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.
hmr: Chun, David chu kula chun a um a; Philistin sipai ruol chu chu lai chun Bethlehema chun an um a.

en: And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!
hmr: Chun, David chun a châk a, “Kul kawtkhâr bula Bethlehem tui- sunsuo tui kha dâwn dingin mi pe um hai sien chu aw!” a ta.

en: And the three brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto Jehovah,
hmr: Chuongchun, mi pathumhai chun Philistin sipaihai chu an nêr- thleng a, kul kawtkhâr bula Beth- lehema tuisunsuoa inthawk chun tui chu an va chawi a, an hung lâk a, David kuomah an hung lâk tah a: nisienlakhawm, David chun tui chu a dawn nawh a, LALPA kuomah a bunthlâk ta lem a.

en: and said, My God forbid it me, that I should do this: shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives in jeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did the three mighty men.
hmr: “Hi hi ka thaw ding hi ka Pathien chun mi khap raw se: an hringna ṭiumtaka sietuhai, hieng mihai hringna thisen hi ka dâwn ding am a nih? An hringna chân huoma hi hi an hung lâk a ni sih a,” a ta. Chuleichun, a dâwn ta nawh a. Hieng thil hi mi thilthawthei pathumhai chun an thaw a nih.

en: And Abishai, the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three; for he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them, and had a name among the three.
hmr: Chun, Joab unaupa Abisai chu sâwmthumhai laia hotu tak a na, ama chun za thumhai chunga chun a fei chu a phawi a, anni chu a that a, pathumhai laia chun hming ṭhat a hlawh a.

en: Of the three, he was more honorable than the two, and was made their captain: howbeit he attained not to the first three.
hmr: Sâwmthumhai lai chun ama chu inza a kai a; chuongchun, anni chunga hotua siem chu a ni tah a; nisienlakhawm, a hmaa pathumhai lai chu a ṭhang nawh.

en: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he slew the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
hmr: Kabzeel mi, mi thilthawtheitak naupa, Jehoiada naupa Benaia, thil nasatakhai thawtu chu a nih: Moaba Ariel naupasal pahnihai chu a that a, a fe thla a, vûr tlâk hun laiin pûk sûnga chun sakeibaknei a that bawk a.

en: And he slew an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and slew him with his own spear.
hmr: Chun, Aigupta mi, mi taksa lientak tawng ngaa insâng a that a; chu Aigupta mi kuta chun puon khâwngtu puonkawl ang hi fei a um a; ama chun hmawl leh a pan thlâk a, Aigupta mi kuta fei chu a lâkpêk a, ama fei ngei chun a that tah a.

en: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighty men.
hmr: Jehoiada naupa Benaia chun hieng thilhai hi a thawh a, mi thil- thawthei pathumhai laia chun hming ṭhat a hlaw tah a.

en: Behold, he was more honorable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three: and David set him over his guard.
hmr: Ngai ta, ama chu mi sâwm- thumhai nêk khan nasatakin inza a kai a, amiruokchu, a hmasatak pa- thumhai lai chu a ṭhang nawh: David chun ama vêngtu pâwl hotua chun a siem a.

en: Also the mighty men of the armies: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,
hmr: Chun, sipai pâwlhai laia mi thil- thawtheihai chu: Joab unaupa Asahel, Bethlehema Dodo naupa Elhanan.

en: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
hmr: Haror mi Sammoth, Pelon mi Helez;

en: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
hmr: Teko mi Ikkes naupa Ira, Anathoth mi Abiezer;

en: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
hmr: Husath mi Sibbekai, Aho mi Illai;

en: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
hmr: Netophath mi Maharai, Neto- phath mi Baana naupa Heled;

en: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
hmr: Benjamin thlaa mi Gibeaa um Ribai naupa Ithai, Pirathon mi Benaia,

en: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
hmr: Gaas vadungtêa um Hurai, Arbath mi Abiel;

en: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
hmr: Baharum mi Azmaveth, Saal- bon mi Eliahba;

en: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,
hmr: Gizon mi Hasem naupasalhai, Harar mi Sage naupa Jonathan;

en: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
hmr: Harar mi Sakar naupa Ahiam, Ur naupa Eliphal,

en: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
hmr: Mekerath mi Hepher, Pelon mi Ahija;

en: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
hmr: Karmel mi Hezro, Ezbai naupa Naarai;

en: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
hmr: Nathan unaupa Joel, Hagri naupa Mibhar;

en: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armorbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
hmr: Ammon mi Zelek, Beroth mi Naharai, Zeruia naupa Joab râl- thuom chawituhai chu:

en: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
hmr: Ithra mi Ira, Ithra mi Gareb;

en: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
hmr: Hit mi Uria, Ahlai naupa Zabad;

en: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
hmr: Reuben mi Siza naupa Adina, Reuben mi hotu le a kuoma mi sâwmthum hai leh;

en: Hanan the son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
hmr: Maaka naupa Hanan, Mith mi Josaphat,

en: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
hmr: Asterath mi Uzzia, Aroer mi Hotham naupasalhai Sama le Jeiel;

en: Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
hmr: Simri naupa Jediael, Tiz mi a unaupa Joha;

en: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
hmr: Mahav mi Eliel, Elnaam nau- pasalhai: Jeribai le Josavia, Moab mi Ithma;

en: Eliel, and Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
hmr: Mezoba mi Obed, Eliel le Jaasiel hai.

en: Now these are they that came to David to Ziklag, while he yet kept himself close because of Saul the son of Kish; and they were among the mighty men, his helpers in war.
hmr: Chun, Kis naupa Saula leia an khâr khum tlat laia Ziklaga David kuoma hunghai chu hienghai hi an nih: anni chu mi thil- thawtheihai laia tiemsa, indonaa ama ṭhangpuituhai chu an nih.

en: They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows from the bow: they were of Saul’s brethren of Benjamin.
hmr: Thalngul leh an inthuom a; thal- ngula thal kâp ding le dêngvira lung dêng dingin vawitieng le changtieng an hmang thei ve ve a; Benjamin thla Saula unauhai an nih.

en: The chief was Ahiezer; then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite, and Jeziel, and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth, and Beracah, and Jehu the Anathothite,
hmr: A hotu tak chu Ahiezer a na, chun, Gibeath mi Semaa naupa Joas; chun, Jeziel le Pelet, Azmaveth naupasalhai le chun; chun, Anathoth mi Jehu le Beraka leh;

en: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty, and Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite,
hmr: sâwmthum chunga le sâwm- thumhai laia mi thilthawtheitak Gibeon mi Ismaia leh; chun, Gederath mi Jozabad le, Johanan le Jahaziel le, Jeremia leh;

en: Eluzai, and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite,
hmr: chun, Haruph mi Sephatia, Semaria, Bealia, Jerimoth le Eluzai;

en: Elkanah, and Isshiah, and Azarel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites,
hmr: Kora mihai Jasobeam, Joezer, Azarel, Issia le Elkana.

en: and Joelah, and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
hmr: Gedora Jeroham naupasalhai Zebadia le Joela leh.

en: And of the Gadites there separated themselves unto David to the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valor, men trained for war, that could handle shield and spear; whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were as swift as the roes upon the mountains:
hmr: Chun, Gad mihai chu thlalêra kula khan David kuomah an um hran bîk a, mi hrât khawkhêng, indo dinga inchûkthiem mi phaw le thal chawi thiem mi; an hmaihai chu sakeibak- nei hmai ang el le, an hrâtzie chu tlâng chunga sakhi anga hrât an nih;

en: Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
hmr: a pakhatna chu Ezer, a pahnina chu Obadia, a pathumna chu Eliab,

en: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
hmr: a palina chu Mismanna, a pangana chu Jeremia;

en: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
hmr: a parukna chu Attai, a pasarina chu Eliel;

en: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
hmr: a parietna chu Johanan, a pakuona chu Elzabad;

en: Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.
hmr: a sâwmna chu Jeremia, sâwm le pakhatna chu Makbanai a nih.

en: These of the sons of Gad were captains of the host: he that was least was equal to a hundred, and the greatest to a thousand.
hmr: Hieng Gad naupasalhai hi sipaihai hotuhai an na; anni laia a châutak chu mi za khat tluk a na, a hrâttak chu mi sâng khat tluk a nih.

en: These are they that went over the Jordan in the first month, when it had overflowed all its banks; and they put to flight all them of the valleys, both toward the east and toward the west.
hmr: Thla khatnaa Jordan vadung a kuong a liem pûr lai khawma kântu- hai chu an nih; chuongchun, chu varuoma a saktieng le a thlangtienga umhai po po chu an intlânsiettir a.

en: And there came of the children of Benjamin and Judah to the stronghold unto David.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun Juda le Benjamin thlahai chu David kuomah kula chun an hung a.

en: And David went out to meet them, and answered and said unto them, If ye be come peaceably unto me to help me, my heart shall be knit unto you; but if ye be come to betray me to mine adversaries, seeing there is no wrong in my hands, the God of our fathers look thereon, and rebuke it.
hmr: David chu anni tuok dingin a va suok a, anni chu a dawn a, an kuomah, “Kei mi ṭhangpui dinga muongumtaka hung in ni chun, ka lungril chu nangnia kawp tlat a ta, amiruokchu, ka kutin pawi a tâwk nawh ti hre zinga; ka hmêlmahai kuoma mîn mantir dinga hung in ni ruok chun, ei thlatuhai Pathien chun, chu chu en sienla cheu, kâwk raw se cheu,” a ta.

en: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, who was chief of the thirty, and he said, Thine are we, David, and on thy side, thou son of Jesse: peace, peace be unto thee, and peace be to thy helpers; for thy God helpeth thee. Then David received them, and made them captains of the band.
hmr: Chun, sâwmthum laia a hotu tak Amasai kuoma chun thlarau chu a hung tlung tah a, ama chun, “David, nangma ta kan na, nangma tienga ṭhang kan nih, nang Jesai naupa; inremna, nanga kuoma chun inremna um sienla, nangma ṭhangpuituhai che kuoma khawm inremna chu um raw se; i Pathien chun a ṭhangpui si cheh a,” a ta. Chun, David chun anni chu a lâwmlût tah a, sipai pâwl hotuhaiah a siem tâwl tah a.

en: Of Manasseh also there fell away some to David, when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle: but they helped them not; for the lords of the Philistines upon advisement sent him away, saying, He will fall away to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.
hmr: Saula do dinga Philistin mi- hai le an hung lai khan, Manasse mi ṭhenkhat chu David tienga chun an pakai a; nisienlakhawm, anni chun an lo ṭhangpui nawh a; Philistin mi hotuhai chun, rem- ruotin ama chu an tir hmang a, “A hotupa Saula kuoma hin pakai a ta, ei lu inhmang rawi ei tih,” an ti sih a.

en: As he went to Ziklag, there fell to him of Manasseh, Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zillethai, captains of thousands that were of Manasseh.
hmr: Chun, ama chu Ziklaga a fe chun Manasse mi Adna, Jozabad, Jediael, Mikael, Jozabad, Elihu le Zillethai hai hi, sipai sâng pâwl hotuhai, Manasse hnama mi, ama tieng an ṭhang a.

en: And they helped David against the band of rovers: for they were all mighty men of valor, and were captains in the host.
hmr: Anni chun David chu inru pâwl laia inthawkin an ṭhangpui a; anni chu mi hrât khawkhêng ruok an ni sih a, sipai pâwl lai khawm hotu an ni bawk a.

en: For from day to day men came to David to help him, until there was a great host, like the host of God.
hmr: Chuongchun, a ni têlin sipai pâwl lientak, Pathien sipaihai ang hiel an ni hmakhat chun David kuom- a chun an hung pei a.

en: And these are the numbers of the heads of them that were armed for war, who came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of Jehovah.
hmr: Hienghi LALPA thu ang pei a, Saula ram chu ama kuoma pe dinga Hebrona David kuoma, indo dinga inthuom saa hunghai hotuhai nizât chu a nih.

en: The children of Judah that bare shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, armed for war.
hmr: Juda thlahai, phaw le fei chawia indo dinga inthuom chu sâng ruk le za riet an nih.

en: Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valor for the war, seven thousand and one hundred.
hmr: Simeon thlahai, indonaa mi hrât khawkhênghai chu sâng sari le za khat,

en: Of the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.
hmr: Levi thlahai chu sâng li le za ruk.

en: And Jehoiada was the leader of the house of Aaron; and with him were three thousand and seven hundred,
hmr: Chun, Jehoiada chu Aron sûng- kuoa chun a ṭhuoitu a na, ama le chun sâng thum le za sari an um a;

en: and Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and of his father’s house twenty and two captains.
hmr: chun, Zadok tlangvâl hrât khawkhêng, a pa pahnamah hotu sâwmhni le pahni.

en: And of the children of Benjamin, the brethren of Saul, three thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept their allegiance to the house of Saul.
hmr: Saula unauhai, Benjamin thlahai chu sâng thum: anni a tam lem tak chu Saula tienga ṭhang an nih.

en: And of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous men in their fathers’ houses.
hmr: Chun, Ephraim thlahai, an pahnama mi hming inthang le mi hrât khawkhênghai chu sîng hni le za riet.

en: And of the half-tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were mentioned by name, to come and make David king.
hmr: Manasse hnam zâtvea chun sîng le sâng riet; anni chu David chu lala siem dinga fe dinga an hming pe ṭhalhai chu an nih.

en: And of the children of Issachar, men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, the heads of them were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their commandment.
hmr: Issakar thlahai, Israel chun ieng am a thaw ding a na ti hre dinga thil umziehai hrethiem mihai; an hotuhai chu za hni an ni a; an unauhai po po chu an thu hnuoia chun an um a nih.

en: Of Zebulun, such as were able to go out in the host, that could set the battle in array, with all manner of instruments of war, fifty thousand, and that could order the battle array, and were not of double heart.
hmr: Zebulun thla, sipai ni dinga fe suok thei ṭhieu, indona khawm a pâwl pâwla ṭhangkhaw thiem mi, indo hriem tinrêng hmang thiem mi chu sîng nga; chuonghai chu indona chu pâwl tlar indiktaka rem thiem, lungril thuo hni nei ni lo an nih.

en: And of Naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty and seven thousand.
hmr: Naphtali thlaa mi hotu sâng khat le, phaw le fei chawi mi sîng thum le sâng sari an nih.

en: And of the Danites that could set the battle in array, twenty and eight thousand and six hundred.
hmr: Dan mihai indona chu a pâwl pâwla ṭhangkhaw thiem mihai chu sîng hni le sâng riet le za ruk.

en: And of Asher, such as were able to go out in the host, that could set the battle in array, forty thousand.
hmr: Aser thlaa mi, sipai pâwla fe suok thei ṭhieu, indona chu a pâwl pâwla ṭhangkhaw thiem mi sîng li.

en: And on the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, a hundred and twenty thousand.
hmr: Jordan râl tienga, Reuben mihai, Gad mihai le Manasse hnam zâtvehai, indona hriem tinrêng hmang thiem mihai chu nuoi khat le sîng hni.

en: All these, being men of war, that could order the battle array, came with a perfect heart to Hebron, to make David king over all Israel: and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.
hmr: Hieng mi po po, indo thiem mi, indona chu a pâwl pâwla rêl fel thiem mihai hi, Israel po po chunga David chu lala siem dingin Hebrona chun lungril hmunkhat putin an hung tâwl a; chun, Israel laia mi dang hrim hrim khawm chu David chu lala siem ding thua chun lungril hmunkhatin an um a.

en: And they were there with David three days, eating and drinking; for their brethren had made preparation for them.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun David rawi chun ni thum sûng chu faa dâwnin an um a; an unauhai chun an ta dingin an lo buotsaipêk sih a.

en: Moreover they that were nigh unto them, even as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought bread on asses, and on camels, and on mules, and on oxen, victuals of meal, cakes of figs, and clusters of raisins, and wine, and oil, and oxen, and sheep in abundance: for there was joy in Israel.
hmr: Chu chau naw khawm chu, anni hnai deuhai; Issakar le Zebulun le Naphtali ram chen khawma, sabeng- tung dâmin, sanghâwngsei dâmin, sabengtung lienchi dâmin, bâwng- chal dâmin, bei dâm, fâk ding tinrêng dâm, theichang bei dâm, grêp ra ṭâwl bâwr dâm, uoin dâm, hriek dâm, bâwngchal le berâm chen khawm tamtak an hung chawi a; Israel rama chun nasataka hlimna a um a.

en: And David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.
hmr: David chun sâng chunga hotu- hai le za chunga hotuhai le ṭhuoitu tinrênghai chu ân râwnpui a.

en: And David said unto all the assembly of Israel, If it seem good unto you, and if it be of Jehovah our God, let us send abroad every where unto our brethren that are left in all the land of Israel, with whom the priests and Levites are in their cities that have suburbs, that they may gather themselves unto us;
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Israel mi hung inkhâwmhai po po kuom- a chun, “Ṭha in ti zâwng a na, LALPA ei Pathien ṭha ti zâwng a ni chun, Israel ram po poa ei unauhai mâksan la umhai kha, an khaw- puihai khawper neihaia thiempuhai le Levi mihai umnaa umhai kha, ei kuoma an hung khâwm theina dingin inchâng ei ta,

en: and let us bring again the ark of our God to us: for we sought not unto it in the days of Saul.
hmr: ei kuomah ei Pathien bâwm kha hang la nâwk tâng ei tiu; Saula hun lai chena kha ei ngaisak ta dêr naw a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And all the assembly said that they would do so; for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui pung- khâwmhai po po chun thaw ding an ti tah a; chu thil chu mipui ngaia chun ân dik sih a.

en: So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor the brook of Egypt even unto the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Ai- gupta vadung Sihora inthawkin Hamath lûtna chena mi chu Kiriath- jearima inthawka Pathien bâwm chu hang la dingin Israel mi po pohai chu a khâwm tah a.

en: And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from thence the ark of God Jehovah that sitteth above the cherubim, that is called by the Name.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le Israel mi po po chu Baala-ah, chu chu Juda rama Kiriath-jearim a nih, Pathien bâwm, cherubhai inkâra LALPA chu chênga a hming an kona hlak chu hang la dingin an hang fe tah a.

en: And they carried the ark of God upon a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
hmr: Chun, Pathien bâwm chu taw- lailîr thar chungah an phur a; Abinadab ina inthawk chun an hung lâk suok a; Uzza le Ahio chun taw- lailîr chu an khal a.

en: And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.
hmr: Chun, David le Israel mi po pohai chu Pathien hmaa chun, hlahai le, ṭingṭanghai le, perkhuonghai le, khuongtêhai le, dârbenthekhai le tawtawrâwthai mûtin an um a.

en: And when they came unto the threshing-floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.
hmr: Chun, Kidon hrizâwl an hung tlung chun; bâwngchalhai chu an insui leiin bâwm chu chel dingin Uzza chun a kutin a hei ban a.

en: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Uzza, and he smote him, because he put forth his hand to the ark; and there he died before God.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA lungin- sen chu Uzza chunga chun a hung chawk a, bâwm chu a kuta a hei ban lei chun ama chu a sukhlum tah a; chutaka chun Pathien hmaah a thi tah a.

en: And David was displeased, because Jehovah had broken forth upon Uzza: and he called that place Perez-uzza, unto this day.
hmr: Chun, Uzza chunga LALPA chun a kut a thlâk lei chun David chu a lungawi naw hleh a, chu hmun chu Perez-uzza ân bûk a, tu chen hin ti a nih.

en: And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun David chun Pathien chu a ṭi tah a, “Iengtin am ka inah ka kuomah Pathien bâwm hi hung la thei tâng ka ta?” a ta.

en: So David removed not the ark unto him into the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun bâwm chu David khuoah ama kuoma chun a sawn ta nawh a, amiruokchu, Git mi Obed-edom ina chun a lâk lût lem tah a.

en: And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months: and Jehovah blessed the house of Obed-edom, and all that he had.
hmr: Chun, Pathien bâwm chu Obed- edom sûngkuo lai, a ina chun thla thum lai a um tah a; chuongchun, Pathienin Obed-edom in sûng le a nei po po chu mal a sâwmpêk a.

en: And Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar-trees, and masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.
hmr: Chun, Tura lal Hiram chun David kuomah mihai a tir a, sidar thing dâm, lung sut mihai dâm, thing rem mihai dâm a in bâwl dingin a tir bawk a.

en: And David perceived that Jehovah had established him king over Israel; for his kingdom was exalted on high, for his people Israel’s sake.
hmr: David chun LALPAIN ama chu Israelhai chunga lalah a siem a nih ti a hriet a; a ram chu a mi Israelhai leiin insângtaka chawisângin a um ti a hriet a.

en: And David took more wives at Jerusalem; and David begat more sons and daughters.
hmr: David chun Jerusalema chun nu- hmei tamtak a nei a, David chun naupasal le naunuhmei a la nei sa pei a.

en: And these are the names of the children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,
hmr: Hienghai hi Jerusalema a nei, a nauhai hming chu a nih: Sammua, Sobab, Nathan, Solomon;

en: and Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpelet,
hmr: Ibhar, Elisua, Elpelet;

en: and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
hmr: Noga, Nepheg, Japhia;

en: and Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
hmr: Elisama, Beeliada le Eliphelet.

en: And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David: and David heard of it, and went out against them.
hmr: Chun, Philistin mihai chun David chu Israel po po chunga lal dingin hriek nâl a ni tah ti an hriet chun, Philistin mihai po po chu David zawng ding chun an hang feh a; chun, David khawm chun a lo hrietin, anni chu tuok dingin a suok tah a.

en: Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.
hmr: Chuongchun, Philistin mihai chu an hung a, Rephaim ruoma chun an hung inzâr a.

en: And David inquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? and wilt thou deliver them into my hand? And Jehovah said unto him, Go up; for I will deliver them into thy hand.
hmr: David chun Pathien kuomah, “Philistin mihai chu ka hang do ding am a nih? Ka kutah anni chu i mi pêk ding am a nih?” tiin ân dawn a. LALPA chun a kuomah, “Hang fe rawh, anni chu i kutah ka pêk ding a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: So they came up to Baal-perazim, and David smote them there; and David said, God hath broken mine enemies by my hand, like the breach of waters. Therefore they called the name of that place Baal-perazim.
hmr: Chuongchun, Baal-perazim chenin an hang feh a; David chun chutaka chun anni chu a hne tâwl a; chun, David chun, “Pathien chun ka hmêlmahai chu ka kutah, tui ting inṭhe ang elin a sukdar tah a ni hi,” a tih a. Chuleiin, chu hmun hminga chun Baal-perazim an inbûk tah a.

en: And they left their gods there; and David gave commandment, and they were burned with fire.
hmr: Chun, anni chun an pathienhai chu chutaka chun an tlânsan a, David chun thu a pêk a, chuonghai chu meiin an raw tah a.

en: And the Philistines yet again made a raid in the valley.
hmr: Philistin mihai chu phaizâwl tieng chun an la hung inzar nâwk ta rawp a.

en: And David inquired again of God; and God said unto him, Thou shalt not go up after them: turn away from them, and come upon them over against the mulberry-trees.
hmr: David chun Pathien a rawn nâwk a, Pathien chun a kuomah, “Anni chu hang hnawt naw la, annia inthawkin inherhmang lem la, thingtheihmi kûng zâwna khan anni chu zu hnawt lem rawh.

en: And it shall be, when thou hearest the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry-trees, that then thou shalt go out to battle; for God is gone out before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.
hmr: Chun, thingtheihmi lêrhaia chun kalpên rihai i hriet pha chun indo dingin fe suok la; Pathien chu i hmaah Philistin sipaihai chu suk- hlum dingin a fe suok tah a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And David did as God commanded him: and they smote the host of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.
hmr: Chun, David chun Pathienin ama thu a pêk ang chun a thawh a; Gibeona inthawk Gezer chen rakin Philistin sipaihai chu a that pei tah a.

en: And the fame of David went out into all lands; and Jehovah brought the fear of him upon all nations.
hmr: David chanchin chu ram po poah ân thang tah a; chuongchun, LALPAIN ama ṭina chu hnam po pohai chungah ân umtir tah a.

en: And David made him houses in the city of David; and he prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a tent.
hmr: David chun David khawpuia chun inhai a bâwl a; Pathien bâwm ta ding khawm chun hmun a buotsai a; chu ding chun puon in a kei a.

en: Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them hath Jehovah chosen to carry the ark of God, and to minister unto him for ever.
hmr: Chun, David chun, “Tu dang khawm ni loin, Levi mihai chauin Pathien bâwm chu hang la raw hai se; LALPA chun anni chu Pathien bâwm phur dinga a ruot le ama ta dinga rawngbâwl zing zing dinga a ruot an ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of Jehovah unto its place, which he had prepared for it.
hmr: Chun, David chun Israel mihai po po chu LALPA bâwm chu a hmun dinga a siema chun hang laa sie dingin, Jerusalema chun a khâwm tah a.

en: And David gathered together the sons of Aaron, and the Levites:
hmr: David chun Aron thlahai chu a khâwm a. Levi mihai leh;

en: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twenty;
hmr: Kohath naupasalhai chu: a hotu tak Uriel le a unauhai za khat le sâwmhni;

en: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty;
hmr: Merari naupasalhai chu: a hotu tak Asaia le a unauhai za hni le sawmhni;

en: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and thirty;
hmr: Gerson naupasalhai chu; a hotu tak Joel le a unauhai za khat le sâwmthum;

en: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred;
hmr: Elizaphan naupasalhai chu: a hotu tak Semaia le a unauhai za hni;

en: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and his brethren fourscore;
hmr: Hebron naupasalhai chu: a hotu tak Eliel le a unauhai sâwmriet;

en: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twelve.
hmr: Uzziel naupasalhai chu: a hotu tak Amminadab le a unauhai za khat le sâwm le pahni:

en: And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, and Eliel, and Amminadab,
hmr: Chun, David chun thiempu Zadok hai, Abiathar hai le Levi mihai; Uriel, Asaia le Joel, Semaia, Eliel le Amminadab chu a ko a,

en: and said unto them, Ye are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites: sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that ye may bring up the ark of Jehovah, the God of Israel, unto the place that I have prepared for it.
hmr: an kuomah, “Levi mihai pa- hnam laia hotuhai in na, a hmun dinga ka buotsai tah hmuna LALPA Israelhai Pathien bâwm chu in hung lâk theina dingin insukthieng unla, nangni le in unauhai leh.

en: For because ye bare it not at the first, Jehovah our God made a breach upon us, for that we sought him not according to the ordinance.
hmr: A hmasa khawm khan nang- niin in phur naw leiin LALPA ei Pathien chun a mi lo sukṭhul tah a; thupêk angtaka ei lo thaw naw leiin,” a ta.

en: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiempuhai le Levi mihai chu LALPA Israelhai Pathien bâwm chu zu la dingin an insukthieng tah a.

en: And the children of the Levites bare the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staves thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Levi thlahai chun Pathien bâwm chu LALPA thu ang taka Mosie thupêk angin zâwnfung- haiin an liengkoin an zâwn a.

en: And David spake to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brethren the singers, with instruments of music, psalteries and harps and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up the voice with joy.
hmr: David chun Levi mihai an hotu tak kuoma chun an unauhai chu thilrimawihai, perkhuonghai, ṭing- ṭanghai, dârbenthekhai le hlim râwla khêk rak rak a, sut dingin hlasak- tuhai ruot dingin a hril a.

en: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
hmr: Chuongchun, Levi mihai chu Joel naupa Heman; a unauhai Berekia naupa Asaph le an unau Merari naupasalhai laia mi chu an ruot a, Kusaia naupa Ethan hai dâm;

en: and with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the doorkeepers.
hmr: chun, anni laia an unauhai ân hnuoi pâwla chun Zekaria, Benaia, Jaaziel, Semiramoth; Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaia, Maaseia, Mattithia, Eliphelehu, Mikneia hai; chun, Obed- edom le Jeiel, kawtkhâr vêngtuhai chu an ruot bawk a.

en: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were appointed, with cymbals of brass to sound aloud;
hmr: Chuongchun, hlasaktuhai He- man, Asaph le Ethan, hai hi dâr dârbenthek inringtaka sut dinga ruot an na;

en: and Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries set to Alamoth;
hmr: chun, Zekaria, Aziel, Semira- moth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseia, Benaia hai chu Alamoth biha sut dinga perkhuong pua ruot an na;

en: and Mattithiah, and Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps set to the Sheminith, to lead.
hmr: chun, Mattithia, Eliphelehu, Mikneia, Obed-edom, Jeiel le Azazia hai hi ṭingṭang Seminith biha per dinga ruot an nih.

en: And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the song: he instructed about the song, because he was skilful.
hmr: Chun, Levi mi hotu Kenania chu hla hotu a na; a thiem leiin hla chu a ṭhuoi a.

en: And Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.
hmr: Berekia le Elkana chu bâwm ta dinga kawtkhâr vêngtu an nih.

en: And Shebaniah, and Joshaphat, and Nethanel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, did blow the trumpets before the ark of God; and Obed-edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
hmr: Sebania, Josaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zekaria, Benaia le Eliezer, thiempuhai chun, Pathien bâwm hmaa chun tawtawrâwthai an mût a; chun, Obed-edom le Jehia chu bâwm vêngtuhai chu an nih.

en: So David, and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah out of the house of Obed-edom with joy.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le Israel upahai le sâng khat chunga hotuhai chu Obed-edom ina inthawka LALPA thuthlungna bâwm chu hlimtaka hung la dingin an fe tah a;

en: And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bare the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, that they sacrificed seven bullocks and seven rams.
hmr: Chuong Levi mihai LALPA thuthlungna bâwm zâwntuhai chu Pathienin a ṭhangpui lei chun bâwng- chal pasari le berâmchal pasariin an inthâwi a.

en: And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites that bare the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the master of the song with the singers: and David had upon him an ephod of linen.
hmr: David chu puon zai inhmi puonin ân thuom a, Levi mihai po po bâwm zâwntuhai le, hlasaktuhai le, hlasaktuhai hotu Kenania hai le chun chuong ang bawkin an inthuom a; David chun zakawsîng puon zai inhmi chu a hâk bawk a.

en: Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah with shouting, and with sound of the cornet, and with trumpets, and with cymbals, sounding aloud with psalteries and harps.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israelhai po po chun ri nasatak leh, saki mût rîk leh, tawtawrâwt ri leh, dârbenthek ri leh, ṭingṭang le perkhuonghaia inring- taka sakin LALPA thuthlungna bâwm chu an hung lâk tah a.

en: And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of Jehovah came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window, and saw king David dancing and playing; and she despised him in her heart.
hmr: Chun, LALPA thuthlungna bâwm chu David khawpui chu a hung tlung chun, Saula naunu Mikal chu tukvera hin a hei dâk a, lal David chu thil sut a, lâmin a hei hmu tah a; chuongchun, a lungril chun a hmusit hle tah a.

en: And they brought in the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings before God.
hmr: Chun, Pathien bâwm chu an hung lâk lût a, Davidin a lo siem puon in lailung laitaka chun an inṭhut tah a; chun, Pathien hmaah pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai le inremna thilinhlânhai an inhlân tah a.

en: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offering and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the name of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, David chun pumraw- hmang thilinhlân le inremna thilin- hlân chu ân hlân hnung chun, LALPA hmingin mipuihai chu mal a sâwm tah a.

en: And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a portion of flesh, and a cake of raisins.
hmr: Chun, Israel mihai mi tin el chu a nuhmei a pasalin, bei tlang le sa tlin le grêp ra ṭâwl a pêk seng a.

en: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of Jehovah, and to celebrate and to thank and praise Jehovah, the God of Israel:
hmr: Chun, Levi mihai mi ṭhenkhat chu LALPA Israelhai Pathien chu inpâka lâwmthu hrila, ama chawi- mawi dingin LALPA bâwm hmaa rawngbâwl hlak ding chun a ruot a;

en: Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with psalteries and with harps; and Asaph with cymbals, sounding aloud;
hmr: a hotu tak chu Asaph a na, ama dawta chun Zekaria, Jaaziel, Semira- moth, Jehiel, Mattithia, Eliab, Benaia, Obed-edom le Jeiel hai; ṭingṭang le perkhuong puhai an nih;

en: and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.
hmr: Asaph chu dârbenthek inring- taka sutin; thiempu Benaia le Jahaziel hai chu Pathien thuthlung bâwm hmaa chun tawtawrâwt leh an um zing bawk a.

en: Then on that day did David first ordain to give thanks unto Jehovah, by the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
hmr: Chun, chu ni chun David chun Asaph le a unauhai LALPA hmaa lâwmthu chu inhlân dingin a ruot hmasatak a.

en: O give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name; Make known his doings among the peoples.
hmr: Aw, LALPA kuomah lâwmthu hril unla, a hming lam ro; Mi tin lai chun a thil thaw inhriettir ro.

en: Sing unto him, sing praises unto him; Talk ye of all his marvellous works.
hmr: Ama chawimmawiin hla sak unla,ama inpâkin sak ro; A thilmak thaw po po thu hril ro.

en: Glory ye in his holy name; Let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah.
hmr: A hming inthieng chu sawng ro; LALPA zawngtuhai lungril chu hlim raw se.

en: Seek ye Jehovah and his strength; Seek his face evermore.
hmr: LALPA le a hrâtna chu zawng unla, A hmêl chu zawng rawp ro.

en: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done, His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
hmr: A thilmak thawhai chu hre zing ro, A thilmakhai le a baua a rorêl suokhai chu:

en: O ye seed of Israel his servant, Ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
hmr: Aw, a siehlaw Israel thlahai, Jakob thla, a ithlanghai.

en: He is Jehovah our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
hmr: Ama chu LALPA ei Pathien chu a nih, A rorêlhai chu hnuoi chung po poa hin a um.

en: Remember his covenant for ever, The word which he commanded to a thousand generations,
hmr: A thuthlung chu kumkhuoin hre zing unla, Suon sâng khat chena a thu lo pêk chu.

en: The covenant which he made with Abraham, And his oath unto Isaac,
hmr: Abraham kuoma a thuthlung le, Isak kuoma a inkhâmna chu.

en: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a statute, To Israel for an everlasting covenant,
hmr: Chu ma chu thuruot ni dingin Jakob kuomah a sukdet a, Israel kuoma kumkhawtluong thuthlung dingin;

en: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, The lot of your inheritance;
hmr: “Kanaan ram hi i kuomah pêng ka ti che, I rochanpuol ding chu,” tiin.

en: When ye were but a few men in number, Yea, very few, and sojourners in it;
hmr: Mi tlâwmte chau in ni lai khan, Anih, mi tlâwmte chau, chutaka mikhuol in na;

en: And they went about from nation to nation, And from one kingdom to another people.
hmr: Hnam tum tum kuomah an fe lawn an fe lawn a, Ram tum tuma inthawkin mi tum tumhai kuomah.

en: He suffered no man to do them wrong; Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
hmr: Tu inêksâwr khawm a phal nawh a. Anih, anni leiin lalhai khawm a kâwk a;

en: Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones, And do my prophets no harm.
hmr: “Ka hriek nâlhai chu tâwk naw unla, Ka zâwlneihai pawi hrim hrim khawm tâwk naw ro,” tiin.

en: Sing unto Jehovah, all the earth; Show forth his salvation from day to day.
hmr: Leihnuoia um po pohai, LALPA chawimawiin hla sak ro, Ni tin a sandamna thu chu inhriettir ro.

en: Declare his glory among the nations, His marvellous works among all the peoples.
hmr: Hnam tin lai chun a ropuizie hril unla, Mi tinrênghai lai chun a thilmak thawhai hril ro.

en: For great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised: He also is to be feared above all gods.
hmr: LALPA chu a ropui a, nasataka inpâk ding a ni sih a, Ama chu pathien po po nêka ṭi ding a nih.

en: For all the gods of the peoples are idols: But Jehovah made the heavens.
hmr: Mipuihai pathienhai chu milimhai an ni sih a, LALPA ruok chun vânhai khi a siem a nih.

en: Honor and majesty are before him: Strength and gladness are in his place.
hmr: Chawimawina le ropuina a hmaah an um a, Hrâtna le hlimna chu a hmun inthiengah an um.

en: Ascribe unto Jehovah, ye kindreds of the peoples, Ascribe unto Jehovah glory and strength;
hmr: Mi tina chi tinrênghai, LALPA kuomah pe unla, LALPA kuoma chun ropuina le hrâtna pe ro.

en: Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name: Bring an offering, and come before him; Worship Jehovah in holy array.
hmr: LALPA kuomah a hming ropui chu pe unla, Thil inhlân ding chawiin, a hmaah hung ro. Aw, inthieng mawina inbelin LALPA chu chibai bûk ro.

en: Tremble before him, all the earth: The world also is established that it cannot be moved.
hmr: Leihnuoia um po pohai, a hmaa chun inthin ro; Khawvêl khawm hi ân hnîng thei nawna dingin sukdetin a um a.

en: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; And let them say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth.
hmr: Vânhai khi lâwmtakin um sienla, hnuoi khawm hi hlimtakin um raw se; Hnam tin lai chun, “LALPA chu lalah a ṭhung a,” ti ro.

en: Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; Let the field exult, and all that is therein;
hmr: Tuisuoriet le a sûnga um po po hi inri hum hum sienla, Lo le a sûnga um po po hi lâwmtakin um raw se.

en: Then shall the trees of the wood sing for joy before Jehovah; For he cometh to judge the earth.
hmr: Chu pha chun ram hnuoia thing po po hi LALPA hmaah hlimin hla sak an tih, Hnuoi ro rêl dingin a hung ding a ni sih a.

en: O give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
hmr: Aw LALPA kuomah lâwmthu hril ro, ama chu a ṭha sih a, A zângaina chu kumkhuoin a um zing sih a.

en: And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, And gather us together and deliver us from the nations, To give thanks unto thy holy name, And to triumph in thy praise.
hmr: A kuoma chun, “Aw Pathien, nang kan sandamna, mi sandam la, Nangin mi ṭhuoi khâwmin,hnamhai laia inthawk chun mi sanhim la, I hming inthieng kuoma lâwmthu hril ding le, Nangma inpâknaa chawimawi ding in,” ti ro.

en: Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, From everlasting even to everlasting. And all the people said, Amen, and praised Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA Israelhai Pathien chu inpâkin um raw se. Chatuona inthawka chatuon chenin. Chun, mipui po po chun, “Amen,” an lo tih a, LALPA an inpâk tah a.

en: So he left there, before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required;
hmr: Chun, ni tina sin ṭûlzie ang peia rawngbâwl zing zing dingin, Asaph le a unauhai chu LALPA thuthlungna bâwm hmaa chun a sie tah a;

en: and Obed-edom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;
hmr: Obed-edom le an unauhai sâwmruk le pariet hai leh; Jeduthun naupa Obed-edom le Hosa chu kawtkhâr vêngtuhai ni dingin;

en: and Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of Jehovah in the high place that was at Gibeon,
hmr: chun, thiempu Zadok le a unau thiempuhai chu Gibeon bâwlhmuna chun, LALPA biekbûk hmaa chun an um a,

en: to offer burnt-offerings unto Jehovah upon the altar of burnt-offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in the law of Jehovah, which he commanded unto Israel;
hmr: Israelhai kuoma thu a pêk tah, LALPA dâna in ziek ang po po ang taka zîngtieng le zântieng tina, pumrawhmanga mâichâma pumraw- hmang thilinhlân chu LALPA hmaa inhlân dingin;

en: and with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were mentioned by name, to give thanks to Jehovah, because his lovingkindness endureth for ever;
hmr: chun, an kuoma chun Heman hai, Jeduthun hai, an hming lama thlanga umhai chu, a zângaina chu kumkhuoin a um zing leia LALPA chu lâwmthu hril dingin an um a;

en: and with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should sound aloud, and with instruments for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun to be at the gate.
hmr: anni laia Heman le Jeduthun chu, ân ring zing ding dârbenthek le tawtawrâwt le chun an um a; Pathien hlahai sakna dinga hlasakna thuom- hnaw kim le chun, chun, Jeduthun naupasalhai chu dai kawtkhâra um ding an nih.

en: And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
hmr: Chun, mi po po chu mâni in seng- ah an ṭîn tah a; David khawm chu a in- sûng chu mal sâwm dingin a ṭîn tah a.

en: And it came to pass, when David dwelt in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of Jehovah dwelleth under curtains.
hmr: Chun, David chun a in chu a hung hluo phing chun, zâwlnei Nathan kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, kei chu Sidar thingphêk inah ka um a. LALPA thuthlungna bâwm ruok chu puon in hnuoiah a um a nih,” a ta.

en: And Nathan said unto David, Do all that is in thy heart; for God is with thee.
hmr: Chun, Nathan chun David kuomah, “I lungrila um ang po po chu thaw el rawh, Pathien chu i kuomah a um annâwm,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
hmr: Chun, chu zân le le chun Pathien thu chu Nathan kuoma chun a hung tlung tah a,

en: Go and tell David my servant, Thus saith Jehovah, Thou shalt not build me a house to dwell in:
hmr: “Hang fe la, ka siehlaw David chu hang hril rawh, ‘LALPA chun hieng hin a ti a nih, chêngna dingin ka ta dingin in mi bâwlpêk naw ti nih;

en: for I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel, unto this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
hmr: Israel thlahai Aiguptaa in- thawka ka hung ṭhuoi suoka inthawk vawisûn ni chen hin inah ka la um ngai nawh a; puon in pakhata inthawka a dangah, biekbûk pakhata inthawka a dangah ka um lem kha.

en: In all places wherein I have walked with all Israel, spake I a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to be shepherd of my people, saying, Why have ye not built me a house of cedar?
hmr: Khâwlai hmuna khawm Israel- hai ka fepuina taphawta chun, ka mihai châwm dinga thu ka ipêk, Israel rorêltuhai a tu tu kuoma khawm khan, Iengdinga Sidar in in mi bâwlpêk naw am a na? ka ti hlak am a nih?’

en: Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith Jehovah of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be prince over my people Israel:
hmr: Chuleiin, ka siehlaw David kuoma chun tuhin hang hril la, ‘Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Ka mi Israelhai chunga lal ni dingin, berâm tlatna hmuna berâm hnung zuinaa inthawk ka lâk suok cheh a;

en: and I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast gone, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee; and I will make thee a name, like unto the name of the great ones that are in the earth.
hmr: i fena taphawtahai chun ka hung ve pei a, i hmêlmahai po po chu i hmaa inthawkin ka sat thlâkpêk cheh a; chuongchun, leihnuoia um, mi ropuitak hming angin i hming chu siem ka tih.

en: And I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the first,
hmr: Ka mi Israelhai ta ding chun hmun ruot ka ta, anni chu phun ka tih, anni hmun ngeia chun an um a, an insawn nâwk ta nawna dingin. Chun, inhma ang khan rîtlona thla- hai chun anni chu sukse ta naw nih,

en: and as from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel; and I will subdue all thine enemies. Moreover I tell thee that Jehovah will build thee a house.
hmr: ka mi Israelhai chunga um dinga rorêltuhai ka ruot nia ang khan; chun, i hmêlmahai po po chu tukdawl bawk ka tih. Chunawa khawm, LALPA chun sûngkuo siem- pêk a che ti hi ka hril che a nih.

en: And it shall come to pass, when thy days are fulfilled that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will set up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
hmr: Chun, i thlatuhai kuoma i fena ding nihai a hung bikim pha chun, nangma hnunga hin i thla ngei hung inngîr ka ta, chu chu i naupasalhai laia mi ngei nîng a tih, chun, a ram chu sukdet bawk ka tih.

en: He shall build me a house, and I will establish his throne for ever.
hmr: Ama chun in mi bâwlpêk a ta; kei khawma a ram chu kumkhuoin tungdingpêk bawk ka tih.

en: I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my lovingkindness away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee;
hmr: A pa nîng ka ta, ama chu ka naupa nîng a tih; i hmaa umpa kuoma inthawka ka lâk hmang ang khan amaa inthawk chun ka zângaina chu la hmang naw ningah;

en: but I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom for ever; and his throne shall be established for ever.
hmr: amiruokchu, ka ina le ka ramah kumkhuoin inngîr dettir lem ka tih; chuongchun, a lalṭhungpha chu chatuonin tungding nîng a tih,’” tiin.

en: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
hmr: Hieng thu po pohai ang tak le, hieng thilhmu po po ang tak hin Nathan chun David chu a hril tah a.

en: Then David the king went in, and sat before Jehovah; and he said, Who am I, O Jehovah God, and what is my house, that thou hast brought me thus far?
hmr: Chun, lal David chu a lût a, LALPA hmaa chun a ṭhung tah a; chun, ama chun, “Aw LALPA Pathien, tu am ka na, ka insûng khawm ieng am a ni hrim a, hieng chen lâwm lâwm i mi ṭhuoi hi?

en: And this was a small thing in thine eyes, O God; but thou hast spoken of thy servant’s house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O Jehovah God.
hmr: Hi hi i mithmua chun thil chîtê a na, aw Pathien, nisienlakhawm, i siehlaw sûngkuo chunga thil la hung tlung ding thu chu i hril a, Aw LALPA Pathien, mi lien ang elin i ngai hi;

en: What can David say yet more unto thee concerning the honor which is done to thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant.
hmr: i siehlaw chawimawia a um chungthua hin, hi bâk hi David hin ieng am i kuoma la hril sa rawp a ta? I siehlaw chu i hriet chieng sih a.

en: O Jehovah, for thy servant’s sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou wrought all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
hmr: Aw LALPA, i siehlaw lei le, nangma lungril puoksuok ang peiin, hieng thil ropuitakhai hi inhriettir dingin, hieng thil ropui po po hi i thaw ta hi.

en: O Jehovah, there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
hmr: Aw LALPA, nanga ang tu- khawm an um nawh a, nang Pathien naw chu a dang an um nawh, kan nahaia kan hriet ta ang peiin.

en: And what one nation in the earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem unto himself for a people, to make thee a name by great and terrible things, in driving out nations from before thy people, whom thou redeemedst out of Egypt?
hmr: Aigupta rama inthawka i mihai an hmaa hnamhai chu hnawt suok peia în tlan suok, thil râpthlâk le thil ropuia i hming siempêk dinga, nang- ma ta ding ngeia nang Pathien feha în tlan suok hnam, i mi Israelhai ang hnuoi chunga hin ieng hnam am an um hrim a?

en: For thy people Israel didst thou make thine own people for ever; and thou, Jehovah, becamest their God.
hmr: I mi Israelhai chu nangin i mi- hai ngei ni kumkhuo dingin i siem a; nang LALPA chu an Pathien i ni sih a.

en: And now, O Jehovah, let the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, and concerning his house, be established for ever, and do as thou hast spoken.
hmr: Tuhin, Aw LALPA, i siehlaw chungthua le a insûng chungthua i hrilhai, kumkhuoa dingin hung suk- det la, i hril angtak ngei chun nangin hung thaw bawk rawh.

en: And let thy name be established and magnified for ever, saying, Jehovah of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel: and the house of David thy servant is established before thee.
hmr: ‘Sipaihai LALPA chu Israelhai Pathien a na, Israelhai Pathien ngei chu: i siehlaw David sûngkuo khawm chu nangma hmaa sukdet a nih,’ tiin, i hming chu tungdinga kumkhuoa chawimawi ni raw se.

en: For thou, O my God, hast revealed to thy servant that thou wilt build him a house: therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray before thee.
hmr: Aw ka Pathien, nangin i siehlaw kuoma hin sûngkuo i siempêk ding a nih ti i suklang ta sih a; chuleiin,i siehlaw hin i hmaa a lungrila ṭawng- ṭai dingin a lo ngam tah a nih.

en: And now, O Jehovah, thou art God, and hast promised this good thing unto thy servant:
hmr: Chun, tuhin, Aw LALPA, nang chu Pathien i na, hieng thil ṭhahai hi i siehlaw kuoma hin i lo tiem tah a;

en: and now it hath pleased thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue for ever before thee: for thou, O Jehovah, hast blessed, and it is blessed for ever.
hmr: chuongchun, tuhin i hmaa kum- khuoa a um zing theina dingin i sie- hlaw sûngkuo chu malsâwmpêk hi i lawmzâwngtak a na; Aw LALPA, nang chun mal i sâwm tah a, kumkhuoa dinga malsâwm a ni ta sih a,” tiin.

en: And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
hmr: Hi hnunga hin hieng hi a hung ni a, David chun Philistin mi- hai chu a hne a, anni chu a tukdawl a, Philistin mihai kuta inthawk chun Gath le a vêl khuohai chu a lâk tah a.

en: And he smote Moab; and the Moabites became servants to David, and brought tribute.
hmr: Chun, Moab khawm chu a hung hneh a, Moab mihai chu David sie- hlawhai an hung ni tah a, chuong- chun, siehai an hung chawi a.

en: And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah unto Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
hmr: Euphrates vadung chena a ram chu indin dinga a fe malamin, Zoba lal Hadarezer chu Mahath chenin David chun a hne bawk a.

en: And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen; and David hocked all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for a hundred chariots.
hmr: David chun amaa inthawk chun sakawr tawlailîr sâng khat le, sakawr chung chuong mi sâng sari le, kea fe mi sîng hni leh a manpêk a, chun, David chun tawlailîr keimi sa- kawrhai chu, tawlailîr za khata ding chau a hlah a, an ke tha a sat vawng a.

en: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succor Hadarezer king of Zobah, David smote of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
hmr: Chun, Damaskaa Suria mihai chu Zoba lal Hadarezer ṭhangpui dinga an hung chun David chun Suria mi sîng hni le sâng hni chu a that a.

en: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought tribute. And Jehovah gave victory to David whithersoever he went.
hmr: Chun, David chun Damaskaa Suriaa chun sipai pâwl a sieh a, chuongchun, Suria mihai chu David siehlawhai an hung ni tah a, chuongchun, sie dâm an hung chawi a. Chun, LALPA chun a fena tieng tieng David chu hnena a pêk pei a.

en: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, David chun Hadarezer sie- hlawhai iphur rângkachak phawhai chu a lâk a, Jerusalemah a hung lâk a.

en: And from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadarezer, David took very much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brazen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
hmr: Chun, Hadarezer khawpui Tibhath le Kun-a inthawkin David chun dârsen tamtak el a lâk bawk a; chuonghai chu Solomon khan dârsen bûr le bêlhai le, inṭhutnahai le, dârsen châwtawl kha a siem a nih.

en: And when Tou king of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer king of Zobah,
hmr: Chun, Hamath lal Tou chun Davidin Zoba lal Hadarezer a hne ti a hriet chun,

en: he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to salute him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadarezer and smitten him (for Hadarezer had wars with Tou); and he had with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.
hmr: Hadarezer chu a do a, a hne ta lei chun, ama chu malsâwma chibai bûk dingin, a naupa Hadoram chu lal David kuoma chun a tir tah a; Hadarezer chu Tou le chun an lo indo rawp hlak tah a; chun, ama chun dârsen le tangkaruo le rângkachak bûr le bêl chi tinrêng elhai chu ama chu a thawn a.

en: These also did king David dedicate unto Jehovah, with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
hmr: Hieng po pohai, tangkaruo le rângkachak hnam tamtakhaia in- thawka a lâkhai chu David chun LALPA kuomah ân hlân a; Edoma inthawk dâm, Moaba inthawk dâm, Ammon thlahaia inthawk dâm, Phi- listin mihaia inthawk dâm, Amalek mihaia inthawk dâmin a lâk a nih.

en: Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah smote of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt eighteen thousand.
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu Zeruia naupa Abisai chun Edom mi sîng le sâng riet chu Chi Ruoma chun a hneh a.

en: And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. And Jehovah gave victory to David whithersoever he went.
hmr: Chun, Edoma chun sipai pâwl a sieh a, chuongchun, Edom mihai po po chu David khuo le tui an hung ni tah a. Chun, LALPA chun a fena taphawtah David chu hnena a pêk pei a.

en: And David reigned over all Israel; and he executed justice and righteousness unto all his people.
hmr: Chun, David chun Israelhai po po chunga chun ro a rêl a; a mi po pohai chungah indiktak le feltakin ro a rêl a.

en: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
hmr: Zeruia naupa Joab chu sipai hotu a na; Ahilud naupa Jehosaphat chu thil inchiktu a na.

en: and Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were priests; and Shavsha was scribe;
hmr: Ahitub naupa Zadok le, Abia- thar naupa Abimelek chu thiempu an na; Savsa chu lekhaziektu a nih;

en: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about the king.
hmr: Jehoiada naupa Benaia chu Kereth le Peleth mihai chunga hotu a nih; chun, David naupasalhai chu lal tienga hotu an nih.

en: And it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Hi hnunga hin hieng hi a hung na; Ammon thlahai lal Nahas chu a thih a, ama aia chun a naupa chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: And David said, I will show kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me. So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
hmr: Chun, David chun, “A pa khan ka chungah lunginsietna ân entir leiin, Nahas naupa Hanun chunga hin lunginsietna inentir vêng ka tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, a pa chungthua chun, ama thlamuon dingin David chun mi a tir a. David siehlawhai chu ama thlamuon dingin Hanun kuoma chun Ammon thlahai rama chun an hung tah a.

en: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, in that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?
hmr: Amiruokchu, Ammon thlahai laia an hotuhai chun Hanun kuoma chun, “David chun i pa chu ân za leiin i kuomah thlamuontuhai a hung tir ni dingin i ring am a nih? Hieng a siehlawhai hi thil zawng suok ding le, hre ding le ram chu enthlit dinga i kuoma hung an ni lem a ni naw maw?” an ta.

en: So Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.
hmr: Chuongchun, Hanun chun David siehlawhai chu a man a, an hmul a vâwpêk a, an silfênhai chu a laiah, a mawng tlung rakin a thlêrpêk a, anni chu a tir hmang tah a.

en: Then there went certain persons, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them; for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.
hmr: Chun, mi tu amanih David kuoma chun a va feh a, mihai an lo sawisak dân chu a va hril tah a. Ama chun anni chu tuok dingin mi a tir a; mihai chu nasatakin an inzak sih a. Chun, lal chun, “In khâkhmulhai ân ṭhang sei hmakhat chu Jerikoah um phawt el ro, chun, hung chau ro,” a tih a.

en: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Aram-maacah, and out of Zobah.
hmr: Chun, Ammon thlahai chu David ta dingin theidaumin an insiem tah ti an hriet phing chun Hanun le Ammon thlahai chun, Zobaa inthawk dâm, Aram-maakaa inthawk dâm, Meso- potamiaa inthawk dâma sakawr puhai le sakawr tawlailîrhai hawna dingin tangkaruo talent sâng khat an thawn tah a.

en: So they hired them thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
hmr: Chuongchun, sakawr tawlailîr sîng thum le sâng hni chu, Maaka lal le a mihai le chun an ruoi tah a; anni chu an hung a, Medeba phâk hmaa chun an inkul tah a. Chuongchun, Ammon thlahai chu an khawpuihaia inthawk chun an hung pungkhâwm a, indo dingin an suok tah a.

en: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
hmr: Davidin chu chu a hriet chun, Joab le mi thilthawthei sipai pâwl po po chu a tir tah a.

en: And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the gate of the city: and the kings that were come were by themselves in the field.
hmr: Chun, Ammon thlahai chu an hung suok a, khawpui dai kawtkhâra chun an intlar a; chun, lalhai a hung ṭhangvehai khawm chu an khâtin phûla chun an um a.

en: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
hmr: Joab chun indona chu hnung- tieng le hmatienga chun an hung nawr a nih ti a hmu chun, Israel laia mi ditumhai chu a thlangsuok a, Suria mihai hmaa chun ân tlartir tah a.

en: And the rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and they put themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
hmr: Mi dang po po chu a unaupa Abisai kuta chun ân kawltir a, Ammon thlahai epa chun an intlar ve tah a.

en: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
hmr: Ama chun, “Suria mihai chu ka ta dinga an hung hrât talaw chun, mi ṭhangpui i ta; chun, Ammon thlahai chu nanga ta dinga an hung hrât talaw bawk chun, keiin ṭhangpui thung ka ti cheh a.

en: Be of good courage, and let us play the man for our people, and for the cities of our God: and Jehovah do that which seemeth him good.
hmr: Insukhuoi unla, ei hnam le ei Pathien khawpuihai sanin insuk- pasal ei tiu: chun, Pathien chun ṭha a ti ang peiin thaw raw se,” a ta.
