en: So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians unto the battle; and they fled before him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Joab le a kuoma mi umhai chun Suria mihai chu indo dingin an va hnai tah a; chuongchun, ama hmaa chun an tlânse tah a.

en: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Ammon thlahai chun Suria mihai chu an tlânsie ti an hriet phing chun, anni khawm chuong ang bawk chun a unaupa Abisai hmaa inthawk chun an tlânse ve tah a, khawpuia chun an lût tah a, Joab ruok chu Jerusalema chun a kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer at their head.
hmr: Chun, Suria mihaiin Israelhai hmaa chun se nâwk zuol an ni tah ti an hriet chun mi an tir a, Vadungpui râla Suria mi umhai chu, Hadarezer sipaihai hotu Sophak rawiin an incha suok tah a.

en: And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel together, and passed over the Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
hmr: Chu chu David kuoma chun an hril a; chun, ama chun Israel mihai po po chu a kei khâwm a, Jordan râl an hung kai a, anni chu an hmuh a, thaw dingin an inzar tah a.

en: And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians the men of seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
hmr: Chun, Israelhai hmaa chun Suria mihai chu an tlânseh a; chuong- chun, David chun sakawr tawlailîr sîng sari puhai le, kea fe mi sîng li Suria mi chu a that tah a; chun, Sophak sipaihotu khawm chu a that tah a.

en: And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and served him: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
hmr: Chun, Hadarezer siehlawhaiin Israelhai hmaa chun an chan a se nâwk zuol an tah ti an hriet chun David le chun inremna an siem a, ama rawng chu an bâwl tah a; Suria mihai khawm chun Ammon thlahai chu an ṭhangpui ngai ta hrim hrim nawh a.

en: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,
hmr: Israel naupasalhai chu hienghai hi an nih; Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Juda, Issakar, Zebulun,

en: Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
hmr: Dan, Josef, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad le Aser.

en: The sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah; which three were born unto him of Shua’s daughter the Canaanitess. And Er, Judah’s first-born, was wicked in the sight of Jehovah; and he slew him.
hmr: Juda naupasalhai chu Era, Onan le Sela an nih; chuhai pathum chu Kanaan mi Bathsua le kâra pieng- hai chu an nih. Chun, Juda nau lutir Era chu LALPA mithmua chun a rilo êm êm a; chuongchun, a sukhlum tah a.

en: And Tamar his daughter-in-law bare him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
hmr: Chun, a monu Tamar chun Perez le Zera a neipêk a, Juda naupasalhai po po chu panga an nih.

en: The sons of Perez: Hezron, and Hamul.
hmr: Perez naupasalhai chu Hezron le Hamul an nih.

en: And the sons of Zerah: Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara; five of them in all.
hmr: Chun, Zera naupasalhai chu Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Kalkol le Dara, an rêngin panga an nih.

en: And the sons of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who committed a trespass in the devoted thing.
hmr: Chun, Karmi naupasal hai chu Achar, thil sera bawseh a, Israelhai laia buoina siemtu chu a nih.

en: And the sons of Ethan: Azariah.
hmr: Ethan naupasal chu Azaria a nih.

en: The sons also of Hezron, that were born unto him: Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.
hmr: Hezron naupasalhai, amaa pieng- hai chu Jerahmeel, Rama le Kelubai an nih.

en: And Ram begat Amminadab, and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;
hmr: Chun, Rama chun Amminadab a nei a; Amminadab chun Nason a nei a; Juda thlahai lal naupa chu;

en: and Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz,
hmr: Nason chun Salma a nei a, Salma chun Boaz a nei a;

en: and Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse;
hmr: Boaz chun Obed a nei a, Obed chun Jessai a nei a.

en: and Jesse begat his first-born Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimea the third,
hmr: Chun, Jessai chun a nau lutîrah Eliab a nei a, a pahnina chu Abinadab a na, a pathumna chu Simea a na;

en: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
hmr: a palina chu Nethanel a na, a pangana chu Raddai a na;

en: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;
hmr: a parukna chu Ozem a na, pasarina chu David a nih;

en: and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.
hmr: chun, an farnuhai chu Zeruia le Abigail an nih. Chun, Zeruia naupa- salhai chu pathum, hieng Abisai, Joab le Asahel hai hi an nih.

en: And Abigail bare Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
hmr: Chun, Abigail chun Amasa chu a nei a, Amasa pa chu Ismael mi Jether a nih.

en: And Caleb the son of Hezron begat children of Azubah his wife, and of Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.
hmr: Chun, Hezron naupa Kaleb chun a nuhmei Azuba (le Jerioth) leh nauhai chu a nei a; hienghai hi a naupasalhai chu an nih; Jeser, Sobab le Ardon hi.

en: And Azubah died, and Caleb took unto him Ephrath, who bare him Hur.
hmr: Chun, Azuba a thi chun Kaleb chun Ephrath chu a nei a, ama chun Hur a neipêk a.

en: And Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezalel.
hmr: Hur chun Uri a nei a, Uri chun Bezalel a nei a.

en: And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he took to wife when he was threescore years old; and she bare him Segub.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun, Hezron chun Gilead pa Makir naunu chu a pâwl a; ama chu kum sâwmruk a tling hnunga nuhmeia a nei a na; chuongchun, amanu chun nau Segub chu a hung neipêk a.

en: And Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.
hmr: Segub chun Jair, Gilead rama khawpui sâwmhni le pathum neitu chu a nei a.

en: And Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath, and the villages thereof, even threescore cities. All these were the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.
hmr: Gesur le Aram chun annia in- thawkin Jair khawpuihai le Kenath chu an lâk a, a kâwl vêl khuohai, khaw sâwmruk leh. Hienghai po po hi Gilead pa Makir naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: And after that Hezron was dead in Caleb-ephrathah, then Abijah Hezron’s wife bare him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
hmr: Chun, Kaleb-ephratha khuoa Hezron thi hnung chun, Hezron nuhmei Abija chun Asur, Tekoa pa chu a neipêk a.

en: And the sons of Jerahmeel the first-born of Hezron were Ram the first-born, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, Ahijah.
hmr: Hezron nau lutîr Jerahmeel naupasalhai chu; Rama chu nau lutîr a na; Buna le Oren le Ozem le Ahija an nih.

en: And Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
hmr: Jerahmeel chun nuhmei dang a nei a, a hming chu Atara a nih; ama chu Onam nu chu a nih.

en: And the sons of Ram the first-born of Jerahmeel were Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.
hmr: Jerahmeel nau lutîr tak Rama naupasalhai chu Maaz, Jamin le Eker an nih.

en: And the sons of Onam were Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai: Nadab, and Abishur.
hmr: Onam naupasalhai chu Sammai le Jada an na; Sammai naupasalhai chu Nadab le Abisur an nih.

en: And the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bare him Ahban, and Molid.
hmr: Abisur nuhmei hming chu Abihail a na, ama chun Ahban le Molid a neipêk a.

en: And the sons of Nadab: Seled, and Appaim; but Seled died without children.
hmr: Nadab naupasalhai chu Seled le Appaim an na; amiruokchu, Seled chu nau nei loin a thi.

en: And the sons of Appaim: Ishi. And the sons of Ishi: Sheshan. And the sons of Sheshan: Ahlai.
hmr: Chun, Appaim naupasal chu Isi a nih. Isi naupasal chu Sesan a nih. Sesan naupasal chu Ahlai a na.

en: And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether, and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.
hmr: Chun, Sammai unaupa Jada naupasalhai chu Jether le Jonathan an na; Jether chu nau nei loin a thi.

en: And the sons of Jonathan: Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
hmr: Jonathan naupasalhai chu Peleth le Zaza an nih. Hieng hai hi Jerahmeel naupasalhai chu an nih.

en: Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.
hmr: Chun, Sesan chun naupasal nei loin naunuhmeihai chau a nei a. Chun, Sesan chun siehlaw, Aigupta mi, a hming Jara chu a nei a.

en: And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant to wife; and she bare him Attai.
hmr: Chuongchun, Sesan chun a naunu chu a siehlaw Jara kuoma chun a nuhmei dingin a pêk a; chuongchun, ama chun Attai a nei- pêk a.

en: And Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,
hmr: Attai chun Nathan a nei a, Nathan chun Zabad a nei a;

en: and Zabad begat Ephlal, and Ephlal begat Obed,
hmr: Zabad chun Ephlal chu a nei a; Ephlal chun Obed a nei a.

en: and Obed begat Jehu, and Jehu begat Azariah,
hmr: Obed chun Jehu a nei a, Jehu chun Azaria chu a nei a;

en: and Azariah begat Helez, and Helez begat Eleasah,
hmr: Azaria chun Helez chu a nei, Helez chun Eleasa a nei a;

en: and Eleasah begat Sismai, and Sismai begat Shallum,
hmr: Eleasa chun Sismai a nei a, Sismai chun Sallum a nei a;

en: and Shallum begat Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begat Elishama.
hmr: Sallum chun Jekamia a nei a, Jekamia chun Elisama a nei a;

en: And the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha his first-born, who was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
hmr: Chun, Jerahmeel unaupa Kaleb naupasal hai chu a nau lutîr tak Mesa, Ziph-hai thlatu chu a nih; Hebron pa Maresa naupasalhai le chun.

en: And the sons of Hebron: Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.
hmr: Chun, Hebron naupasalhai chu Kora, Tappua, Rekem le Sema an nih.

en: And Shema begat Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem begat Shammai.
hmr: Chun, Sema chun Jorkeam pa Raham chu a nei a; Rekem chun Sammai a nei a.

en: And the son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.
hmr: Sammai naupa chu Maon a na; Maon chu Bethzur pa a nih.

en: And Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Haran, and Moza, and Gazez; and Haran begat Gazez.
hmr: Kaleb thaikêm Epha chun Haran le Moza le Gazez a nei a; Haran chun Gazez ma a nei a.

en: And the sons of Jahdai: Regem, and Jothan, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.
hmr: Jahdai naupasalhai chu Regem, Jotham, Gesan, Pelet, Epha le Saaph an nih.

en: Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Sheber and Tirhanah.
hmr: Chun, Kaleb thaikêm Maaka chun Seber le Tirhana chu a nei a.

en: She bare also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena, and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
hmr: Chun, Madmanna pa Saaph le Makbena pa Seva le Gibea pa chu a nei a; chun, Kaleb naunu chu Aksa a nih.

en: These were the sons of Caleb, the son of Hur, the first-born of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,
hmr: Ephratha nau lutîr Hur naupa Kaleb naupasalhai chu; Kiriath-jea- rim pa Sobal;

en: Salma the father of Beth-lehem, Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
hmr: Beth-lehemhai thlatu Salma, Beth-gaderhai thlatu Hareph leh an nih.

en: And Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.
hmr: Chun, Sobal pa Kiriath-jearim chun naupasalhai a nei a; Haroe le Menuhoth mi zâtve hai chu.

en: And the families of Kiriath-jearim: The Ithrites, and the Puthites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
hmr: Chun, Kiriath-jearim sûngkuo- hai chu Ith mihai, Put mihai, Sumath mihai, Misra mihai hi an nih; annia inthawk chun Zorath mihai, Estaol mihai hi an hung suok a nih.

en: The sons of Salma: Beth-lehem, and the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
hmr: Salma naupasalhai chu Beth- lehem hai, Netophath mihai le Atroth-beth-joab le Manahath mi zâtve Zor mihai chu an nih.

en: And the families of scribes that dwelt at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These are the Kenites that came of Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
hmr: Chun, lekhaziektu sûngkuo- hai Jabez-a chênghai chu Tirath mihai, Simeath mihai, Sukath mihai hi an nih. Hieng mihai hi Rekab sûngkuo thlatu Hammath-a in- thawka Ken mi hung suokhai chu an nih.

en: And it came to pass, at the time of the return of the year, at the time when kings go out to battle, that Joab led forth the army, and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah, and overthrew it.
hmr: Chun, kum a hung invawi a, lalhai chu indonaa an fe hlakna huna chun, Joab chun sipai thilthawtheina chu hmangin Ammon mihai ram chu a suksiet a, a hung a, Rabba khawm chu a hung inhuol tah a. Amiruokchu, David chu Jerusa- lema khan a um a, Joab chun Rabba chu a hung rûn a, a hne tah a.

en: And David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon David’s head: and he brought forth the spoil of the city, exceeding much.
hmr: David chun an lal lua inthawk chun lallukhum chu a lâk a, râng- kachak talent tluka rik a nih, lunghluhai khawm a um bawk a; chu chu David lu chunga chun inkhumtir a ni tah a, khawpuia râllâk sumhai chu a hung lâk suok a, tam tak el a nih.

en: And he brought forth the people that were therein, and cut them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes. And thus did David unto all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chutaka um mihai chu a hung ṭhuoi suok a, hreipui le thîr kuoi- kimhai le thing âtnahaiin anni chu sin ân thawtir tâwl a. Chuong ang seng chun David chun Ammon mihai khawpui po poa chun a thawh a. Chun, David le a mihai po po chu Jerusalema chun an kîr nâwk tah a.

en: And it came to pass after this, that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines: then Sibbecai the Hushathite slew Sippai, of the sons of the giant; and they were subdued.
hmr: Chun, hi hnunga hin Philistin mihai leh Gezerah indona a suok tah a; chun, Husath mi Sibbekai chun Rapha naupa Sippai chu a that a, anni chu an dawl tah a.

en: And there was again war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Philistin mihai ma leh indona a um nâwk a; Git mi Goliath unaupa Lahmi chu Jair naupa Elhanan chun a that a; chu mipa feiṭhut chu puonkhâwngtu puonkawl ang a nih.

en: And there was again war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, whose fingers and toes were four and twenty, six on each hand, and six on each foot; and he also was born unto the giant.
hmr: Chun, Gath-a chun indona a um nâwk a, chutaka chun mi lientak el hi a um a, a kepâr le kutpârhai chu sâwmhni le pali a na; kut pakhatah kutpâr paruk pei le, ke pakhatah kepâr paruk pei; ama khawm chu mi lien chia pieng hrim a nih.

en: And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea David’s brother slew him.
hmr: Chun, ama chun Israel mihai a hung hrawk lai chun David unaupa Simea naupa Jonathan chun ama a that a.

en: These were born unto the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
hmr: Hienghai hi Gath khuoa mi lien hrima pienghai chu an nih; anni chu David le a siehlawhai kuta chun an lo tlu tah a.

en: And Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to number Israel.
hmr: Setan chu Israel mihai chunga chun a hung tho a, David chu Israel mihai chu ân tiemtir tah a.

en: And David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, Go, number Israel from Beer-sheba even to Dan; and bring me word, that I may know the sum of them.
hmr: David chun Joab le mipuihai hotuhai kuoma chun, “Fe unla, Beer- sebaa inthawka Dan chenin Israelhai chu hung tiem unla, an ni zât ka hriet theina dingin thu mi hung intlun ro,” a ta.

en: And Joab said, Jehovah make his people a hundred times as many as they are: but, my lord the king, are they not all my lord’s servants? why doth my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of guilt unto Israel?
hmr: Joab chun, “LALPA chun a mihai chu an ni hlak zât let za khawma sukpung sienla, ka pu lal, ka pu siehlawhai an ni vawng tho a ni naw am a nih? Iengdingin am ka pu hin hieng ang thil hi a hriet nuom a ni leh? Israel ta dingin iengdingin am rîtlona bul hung ni el a ta?” a ta.

en: Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed, and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal thu chun Joab chu a hne tah a. Chuongchun, Joab chu a fe suok a, Israel ram po po chu a fang suok a, Jerusalemah a hung nâwk a.

en: And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand men that drew sword: and Judah was four hundred threescore and ten thousand men that drew sword.
hmr: Chun, Joab chun mipuihai tiem- na nizât chu David kuomah a pêk tah a. Chuongchun, Israel rama mi chu kâwlhnâm chawi thei ṭhieu mi mak- taduoi khat le nuoi khat an na; Judaa chun kâwlhnâm chawi thei ṭhieu chu mi nuoi li le sîng sari an nih.

en: But Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them; for the king’s word was abominable to Joab.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Benjamin chi le Levi mihai chu anni lai chun a tiem sa ve nawh a; Joab ngaia chun lal thu chu theida a um vieu si leiin.

en: And God was displeased with this thing; therefore he smote Israel.
hmr: Chun, hi thila hin Pathien chu a lâwm ta naw hle el a; chuleiin, Israel ram chu a hung hrem tah a.

en: And David said unto God, I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing: but now, put away, I beseech thee, the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
hmr: Chun, David chun Pathien kuom- ah, “Hi thil ka lo thaw taa hin, nasa- takin thil ka suksuol a nih; amiruok- chu, tuhin ka ngên che, i siehlaw khawhlona hi ngaidam rawh; invêt thlâktakin ka lo thaw ta sih a,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Gad, David’s seer, saying,
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun David zâwl- nei Gad kuoma chun, “Fe la, David kuoma chun hieng hin va hril rawh.

en: Go and speak unto David, saying, Thus saith Jehovah, I offer thee three things: choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.
hmr: LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: ‘Thil pathum ka ruotpêk cheh a, hi laia pakhat hi thlang rawh, i ta dinga ka thawpêk theina ding chein,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: So Gad came to David, and said unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Take which thou wilt:
hmr: Chuongchun, Gad chu David kuoma chun a feh a, a kuoma chun, “LALPA chun hieng hin a tih; i dittak thlang rawh;

en: either three years of famine; or three months to be consumed before thy foes, while the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of Jehovah, even pestilence in the land, and the angel of Jehovah destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to him that sent me.
hmr: kum thum sûng ṭâm amanih; i hmêlmahai kâwlhnâmin a hnawt phâk pha cheh a, ihmêlmahai hmaa thla thum sûng sukbohmanga um amanih; annawleh, Israel ram sûng po poa LALPA vântirkoin hung sukse a, ram sûnga hri hung inlêng a, LALPA kâwlhnâm chu ni thum sûng tuor chu. Tuhin ngaituo la, ieng dawnna am a mi tirtu kuoma chun kân kîr nâwk ding a na,” a ta.

en: And David said unto Gad, I am in a great strait: let me fall, I pray, into the hand of Jehovah; for very great are his mercies: and let me not fall into the hand of man.
hmr: Chun, David chun Gad kuoma chun, “Nasatakin ka lunginzîng a,LALPA kutah a tlûkin tlulût phawt el ka tih; a zângaina chu a nasa sih a, chuleiin, mihriem kuta chun mîn tlûktir êm naw nih,” a ta.

en: So Jehovah sent a pestilence upon Israel; and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPA chun Israel chunga chun hri a tir tah a, Israel mihai chu sîng sari an thi a.

en: And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it: and as he was about to destroy, Jehovah beheld, and he repented him of the evil, and said to the destroying angel, It is enough; now stay thy hand. And the angel of Jehovah was standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
hmr: Chun, Pathien chun sukse dingin Jerusalema chun vântirko a tir a; chuonga a suksiet ding lai tak chun LALPA chun a hmuh a, thil ṭha naw thaw a tum chu ân kîr a; chuongchun, a suksetu ding vântirko kuoma chun, “A hun tah, i kut tuhin chel hri rawh,” a ta. Chun, vântirko chu Jebus mi Ornan hrizâwla chun a ngîr ta zing a.

en: And David lifted up his eyes, and saw the angel of Jehovah standing between earth and heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
hmr: Chun, David chu a hung dâk suok a, LALPA vântirko hnuoi le vân kâra ngîr chu a hang hmu tah a; a kâwlhnâm phawi sain, Jerusalem tienga bân pharin a hmuh a. Chun, David le upahai chu saiip puon an sil a, an hmaia hnuoi sikin an bawk tâwl tah a.

en: And David said unto God, Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? let thy hand, I pray thee, O Jehovah my God, be against me, and against my father’s house; but not against thy people, that they should be plagued.
hmr: Chun, David chun Pathien kuoma chun, “Mipuihai chu tiem dinga thu pe kha kei ka ni naw am a nih? Khawhlotaka thawa, lo suk- suol ta kha kei ngei ka nih; ami- ruokchu, hieng berâm ruolhai hin ieng am an thawh a? Aw LALPA ka Pathien, ka hni che, i kut chu ka chunga le ka thlatuhai sûngkaw chunga hin tla sienla; i mihai chung- ah ni loin, hri tuora an um nawna dingin,” a ta.

en: Then the angel of Jehovah commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and rear an altar unto Jehovah in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
hmr: Chun, LALPA vântirko chun, Jebus mi Ornan hrizâwla chun LALPA ta dinga mâichâm hang bâwl dingin David chu fe dingin, David kuoma hril dingin Gad chu thu a pêk tah a.

en: And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spake in the name of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, Gad hril ang chun, LALPA hminga a hril ang ngei chun David chu a hang fe tah a.

en: And Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and his four sons that were with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
hmr: Chun, Ornan chu a hei ngha kîr chun vântirko chu a hmuh a, a naupasalhai pali ama le umhai ruok chu an inbi a. Ornan chun bu a chîl lai a na.

en: And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing-floor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
hmr: Chun, David chun Ornan a hung pan chun Ornan chun a hei en a, David chu a hmu a, hrizâwla inthawk chu a hung suok a, a hmaia hnuoi sikin David hmaa chun a kûn tah a.

en: Then David said to Ornan, Give me the place of this threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar unto Jehovah: for the full price shalt thou give it me, that the plague may be stayed from the people.
hmr: Chun, David chun Ornan kuom- a chun, “LALPA ta dinga mâichâm ka siem theina dingin hi hrizâwl hmun hi mi pe rawh; a man huntâwk zet angin mi pêng i ta; mipuihaia inthawka hri ân kieng theina dingin,” a ta.

en: And Ornan said unto David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes: lo, I give thee the oxen for burnt-offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal-offering; I give it all.
hmr: Chun, Ornan chun David kuom- ah, “Nangmân la el rawh, ka pu lal hin a ngai a ṭha a ti ang peiin thaw el raw se; en ta, hi bâwngchal pumraw- hmang thilinhlâna dingin ka pêk cheh a, bu vuokna thuomhnawhai hi a thing dingin, chun, bu hi bu thilinhlân dingin; a rêngin ka pêk vawng che a nih,” a ta.

en: And king David said to Ornan, Nay; but I will verily buy it for the full price: for I will not take that which is thine for Jehovah, nor offer a burnt-offering without cost.
hmr: Chun, lal David chun Ornan kuoma chun, “Ni lo e a, a man kim chie ang takin kân châwk ding annâwm; nangma ta chu LALPA ta dingin ka lâkpêk ding che a ni nawh a, chun, pumrawhmang thilinhlân khawm chu man bo chun kân hlân ding a ni nawh,” a ta.

en: So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
hmr: Chuongchun, David chun Ornan kuoma chun rângkachak a bûk a, shekel za ruk a hmun man ding chun a pêk tah a.

en: And David built there an altar unto Jehovah, and offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings, and called upon Jehovah; and he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt-offering.
hmr: Chun, Davidin chutaka chun mâichâm chu LALPA ta dingin a siem a, pumrawhmang thilinhlân le, in- remna thilinhlân chu ân hlân a, LALPA chu a ko tah a; chun, ama chun vâna inthawk chun pumraw- hmangna mâichâm chungah meiin a zuk dawn tah a.

en: And Jehovah commanded the angel; and he put up his sword again into the sheath thereof.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun vântirko chu thu a pêk a; a kâwlhnâm chu a bâwma chun a khum nâwk tah a.

en: At that time, when David saw that Jehovah had answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
hmr: Chu huna chun, Jebus mi Ornan hrizâwla chun LALPA chun a zuk dawn ti a hmu phing chun chutaka chun ân thâwi tah a.

en: For the tabernacle of Jehovah, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt-offering, were at that time in the high place at Gibeon.
hmr: LALPA biekbûk thlalêra Mosien a siem le, pumrawhmang thilin- hlânna mâichâm chu, chu huna chun Gibeona bâwlhmuna chun a la um zing sih a.

en: But David could not go before it to inquire of God; for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of Jehovah.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chu hmaa chun Pathien rawn dingin David chu a fe thei nawh a,LALPA vântirko kâwlhnâm lei chun a ṭi tlat sih a.

en: Then David said, This is the house of Jehovah God, and this is the altar of burnt-offering for Israel.
hmr: David chun, “Hi hi LALPA Pathien in a na, hi hi Israel ta dinga pumrawhmang thilinhlânna mâichâm chu a nih,” a ta.

en: And David commanded to gather together the sojourners that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
hmr: David chun Israel rama mikhuol umhai chu kei khâwm dingin thu a pêk a; Pathien in bâwlna dinga lung sut dingin lung suttuhai a ruot a.

en: And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the couplings; and brass in abundance without weight;
hmr: David chun ân huonna kawt- khâra ding le a zawmna vêlhaia dingin thîr tamtak a kilna dingin a buotsai a; dârsen chi tamtak el a bûk hriet lo,

en: and cedar-trees without number: for the Sidonians and they of Tyre brought cedar-trees in abundance to David.
hmr: Sidar thing a nizât hriet lo; Zidon mihai le Tura mihai khan David kuomah Sidar thing an hung lâk ṭeu sih a.

en: And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for Jehovah must be exceeding magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.
hmr: Chun, David chun, “Ka naupa Solomon hi a naupangin iengkhawm a hriet si nawh a, LALPA ta dinga in bâwl ding hi ropuitak a ni ding a na, ram po poa ropuitak le hming inthang tak el ding a ni sih a; chuleiin, keiin buotsai ka tih,” a ta. Chuongchun, David chun a thi hma ngei chun nasatakin a buotsai tah a.

en: Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build a house for Jehovah, the God of Israel.
hmr: Chun, a naupa Solomon chu a ko a; Israelhai Pathien, LALPA ta dinga in bâwl dingin thu a pêk tah a.

en: And David said to Solomon his son, As for me, it was in my heart to build a house unto the name of Jehovah my God.
hmr: David chun Solomon kuomah, “Ka naupa, keia ta ding chun ka Pathien LALPA hming ta dinga in bâwl chu ka lungrilah a um a.

en: But the word of Jehovah came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars: thou shalt not build a house unto my name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPA thu chu ka kuomah a hung tlung a, ‘Nang chun thisen tamtak în suo tah a, indona ropuitakhaia khawm i ṭhang tah a; ka mithmua hnuoi chunga thisen tamtak în suo ta leiin ka hming ta dingin in bâwl naw ti ni,

en: Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about; for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
hmr: Ngai ta, naupasal hung nei i ta, ama chu mi sâwldamtak nîng a tih, a vêlin, a hmêlmahaia inthawk khawm- in ama chu râlmuongna pêng ka ta, a hming khawm Solomon nîng a ta, ama hun laia chun Israel rama hin muongna le râlmuongna pêng ka tih;

en: He shall build a house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
hmr: keia hming ta dingin in bâwl a ta, ama chu ka naupa nîng a ta, kei ama pa ni bawk ka tih; chun, a ram lalṭhungpha chu Israel chungah kumkhawtluongin sukdet ka tih,’ tiin.

en: Now, my son, Jehovah be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of Jehovah thy God, as he hath spoken concerning thee.
hmr: Tuhin, ka naupa, LALPA chu i kuomah um a ta, inhlâwtlingtir a ti cheh a, nangma chungthua a hril ta angin, i Pathien LALPA in chu bâwl la.

en: Only Jehovah give thee discretion and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel; that so thou mayest keep the law of Jehovah thy God.
hmr: LALPA chun hrietthiem theina le thlierthiem theina pe sienla che; Israel chunga thuneina pe raw se che; chuongchun, LALPA i Pathien dân chu i kawl zing theina dingin,

en: Then shalt thou prosper, if thou observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which Jehovah charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; fear not, neither be dismayed.
hmr: Israel chungthua LALPAIN Mosie thu a pêk, rorêlna hai le dânhai chu thaw dinga i zâwm tlat chun hung hlawtling i tih; insukhrât la, insukhuoi la, beidawng naw la, ṭit khawm ṭi naw rawh.

en: Now, behold, in my affliction I have prepared for the house of Jehovah a hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver, and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto.
hmr: Tuhin ngai ta, ka theitâwk hu ang peiin, LALPA in ta ding chun rângkachak talent nuoi khat, tang- karuo talent maktaduoi khat, dârsen le thîr chu a bûk zât hriet lo ka buotsai tah a; chu ding chun, lung le thing khawm a tam tâwkin ka buotsai tah a nih; chu chu sunzawm thei i ta.

en: Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all men that are skilful in every manner of work:
hmr: Chunawa khawm, i kuomah sinthawtuhai tam tâwk tak, lung suttuhai, a âttuhai, thing thaw mi, sin tinrênga themthiem mihai;

en: of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and Jehovah be with thee.
hmr: rângkachak le, tangkaruo le, thîr le dârsena themthiemhai, nizât hriet sêng lo rau an na; tho la, thaw el rawh, LALPA chu i kuomah um a tih,” tiin.

en: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
hmr: David chun Israel hotuhai po po chu a naupa Solomon chu ṭhangpui dingin thu a pêk bawk a;

en: Is not Jehovah your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand; and the land is subdued before Jehovah, and before his people.
hmr: “LALPA in Pathien chu in kuomah a um a ni naw am a nih? Kil tin ela chun muongna a pêk cheu a ni naw am a nih? A ram hluotuhai chu ka kutah a hung pêk tâwl ta sih a; chun, a ram khawm chu LALPA le a mihai hmaa chun an intuklût ta sih a.

en: Now set your heart and your soul to seek after Jehovah your God; arise therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of Jehovah God, to bring the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of Jehovah.
hmr: Tuhin, LALPA in Pathien chu zawng dingin in lungril le in lungvar chu ama tieng ngha unla, tho unla, chuongchun, LALPA Pathien hmun inthieng; LALPA thuthlungna bâwm le, Pathien bûr le bêl inthienghai chu hung lâkna dingin, LALPA hmingin in bâwl ro,” tiin.

en: Now David was old and full of days; and he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
hmr: David chu a hung tar tah a, a hung upa ta hle a, a naupa Solomon chu Israel chunga lal dingin a siem tah a.

en: And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
hmr: Chun, Israel upahai po po le thiempuhai le Levi mihai chu a ko khâwm vawng a.

en: And the Levites were numbered from thirty years old and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand.
hmr: Levi mihai chu kum sâwmthum chung tienga po chu tiem an na; an tiem dânbi ang chun an nizât chu, patling sîng thum le sâng riet an nih.

en: Of these, twenty and four thousand were to oversee the work of the house of Jehovah; and six thousand were officers and judges;
hmr: Hi laia mi sîng hni le za li hin LALPA in sin chu an enkawl ding a na;

en: and four thousand were doorkeepers; and four thousand praised Jehovah with the instruments which I made, said David, to praise therewith.
hmr: chun, sâng ruk dang chu hotuhai le rorêltuhai an nih; sâng li chu kawtkhâr vêngtuhai an na; sâng li dang chun, “Inpâkna dinga ka siem,” Davidin a ti, chuong thuomhnawhai le chun LALPA chu inpâk ding an nih.

en: And David divided them into courses according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
hmr: David chun anni chu a pâwl peiin, Levi naupasalhai ang peiin a ṭheh a; Gerson le Kohath le Merari hai hi.

en: Of the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.
hmr: Gerson mia chun Ladan le Simei an na.

en: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
hmr: Ladan naupasalhai chu: Jehiel chu a hotu tak le, Zetham le Joel, hi pathum hi.

en: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of the fathers’ houses of Ladan.
hmr: Simei naupasalhai chu: Selo- moth, Haziel le Haran, hi pathum hi. Hienghai hi Ladan sûngkuo pahnam luhai chu an nih.

en: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
hmr: Chun, Simei naupasalhai chu: Jahath, Zina, Jeus le Beria an nih. Hieng palihai hi Simei naupasalhai an nih.

en: And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they became a fathers’ house in one reckoning.
hmr: Chun, Jahath chu a hotu tak a na, Ziza chu a pahnina; amiruokchu, Jeus le Beria chun naupasal tamtak an nei nawh a; chuleiin, tiem dânah thlâ khat an nih.

en: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
hmr: Kohath naupasalhai chu: Amram, Izhar, Hebron le Uzziel, hi pali hi.

en: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons, for ever, to burn incense before Jehovah, to minister unto him, and to bless in his name, for ever.
hmr: Amram naupasalhai chu: Aron le Mosie; chu, Aron le a naupasalhai chu ama le a nauhai chun thil inthienghai chu hlânthieng a, kum- khuoa LALPA hmaa riminhnik raw ding le, ama rawngbâwl ding le, ama hminga malsâwm kumkhuo dinga suktum an nih.

en: But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien mi Mosie chu, a naupasalhai chu Levi hnam laia lam sa a na.

en: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
hmr: Mosie naupasalhai chu: Gerson le Eliezer an nih.

en: The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
hmr: Gerson naupasalhai chu: Sebuel chu a hotu tak a nih.

en: And the sons of Eliezer were: Rehabiah the chief; and Eliezer had no other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
hmr: Eliezer naupasalhai chu: Rehabia chu a hotu tak a nih. Eliezer chun naupasal dang a nei nawh a; amiruokchu, Rehabia naupasalhai chu an tam hle.

en: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
hmr: Izhar naupasalhai chu: Selo- mith chu a upa tak a nih.

en: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
hmr: Hebron naupasalhai chu: Jeria a hotu tak a na, a pahnina chu Amaria, a pathumna chu Jahaziel, a palina chu Jekameam.

en: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief, and Isshiah the second.
hmr: Uzziel naupasalhai chu: Mika chu a upa tak a na, a pahnina chu Issia.

en: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
hmr: Merari naupasalhai chu: Mahli le Musi. Mahli naupasalhai chu: Eleazar le Kis.

en: And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters only: and their brethren the sons of Kish took them to wife.
hmr: Chun, Eleazar chu a thih a, naupasal a nei nawh, naunuhmei chau a nei; chun, an unaupahai, Kis naupasalhai chun anni chu nu- hmeiah an nei tâwl a.

en: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
hmr: Musi naupasalhai chu: Mahli leh, Eder leh, Jeremoth leh, pathum.

en: These were the sons of Levi after their fathers’ houses, even the heads of the fathers’ houses of those of them that were counted, in the number of names by their polls, who did the work for the service of the house of Jehovah, from twenty years old and upward.
hmr: Hienghai hi an pahnam anga Levi naupasalhai chu an nih, tiemna laia an pahnamhai luhai chu an na, LALPA ina rawngbâwlnaa sinthaw- tuhai, tiem an ni dânbi anga hming suota nizât, kum sâwmhnia in- thawka chungtieng an nih.

en: For David said, Jehovah, the God of Israel, hath given rest unto his people; and he dwelleth in Jerusalem for ever:
hmr: David chun, “LALPA Israelhai Pathien chun a mihai chu muongna a pêk a;

en: and also the Levites shall no more have need to carry the tabernacle and all the vessels of it for the service thereof.
hmr: chun, Levi mihai khawm chun a biekbûk le chutaka a rawngbâwlna bûr le bêlhai po po chu an zâwn a ṭûl bawk ta nawh a,” a ti sih a.

en: For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were numbered, from twenty years old and upward.
hmr: David thu nuhnung tak ang- in, Levi thlahai chu, kum sâwm- hni le a chungtienga po chu tiem an na.

en: For their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of Jehovah, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, even the work of the service of the house of God;
hmr: An sinthaw chu Pathien ina rawngbâwlna sinhai: thil inthieng po pohai sukthieng dâm, pindanahai le inhuonna tuol sûnga LALPA Ina rawngbâwlnaa chun Aron naupa- salhai chu an ṭhangpui ding a ni sih a;

en: for the showbread also, and for the fine flour for a meal-offering, whether of unleavened wafers, or of that which is baked in the pan, or of that which is soaked, and for all manner of measure and size;
hmr: entirna bei ta ding dâm, bu thilinhlân dinga beiphit inditaka ding, chawl ṭhanglo bei amanih, bêl dara zêu amanih, a suonga suong amanih, ieng anga lien le ieng ang tiet ding khawmin;

en: and to stand every morning to thank and praise Jehovah, and likewise at even;
hmr: zîng tina Pathien inpâk dinga ngîr dingin, chuong ang bawkin zântieng khawm;

en: and to offer all burnt-offerings unto Jehovah, on the sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the set feasts, in number according to the ordinance concerning them, continually before Jehovah;
hmr: châwlnihai dâm, thlatharhai dâm, ruoiṭhena bi ruotahai dâma LALPA hmaa chuong chungthua thaw rawp a ni ding dân ang peia LALPA kuoma pumrawhmang thilin- hlân chu inhlân ding dâmin;

en: and that they should keep the charge of the tent of meeting, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren, for the service of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: chun, LALPA ina rawngbâwlna dinga, an unau Aron thlahai sin kawl le, hmun inthieng enkawlna sin le, intuokna in enkawlna sin chu an kawl ding a nih;

en: And the courses of the sons of Aaron were these. The sons of Aaron: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
hmr: Aron naupasalhai pâwlhai chu hieng hi a nih: Aron naupa- salhai chu: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar le Ithamar an nih.

en: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest’s office.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Nadab le Abihu chu an pa nêkin an thi hmasa a, nau an nei nawh a; chuongchun, Eleazar le Ithamar chun thiempu sin chu an thawh tah a.

en: And David with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their ordering in their service.
hmr: Chun, David chun an rawng- bâwlnaa an sinthaw ang peiin, Zadok, Eleazar nauhai le, Ahimelek, Ithamar nauhai chu a ṭheh a.

en: And there were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar; and thus were they divided: of the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen, heads of fathers’ houses; and of the sons of Ithamar, according to their fathers’ houses, eight.
hmr: Ithamar naupasalhai laia nêk chun Eleazar naupasalhai laia chun hotu tam lem hmu a na; chuong ang chun ṭhe an na; Eleazar naupasalhai pahnam luhai chu sâwm le paruk an na, Ithamar naupasalhai chu an pahnam ang peiin pariet an nih.

en: Thus were they divided by lot, one sort with another; for there were princes of the sanctuary, and princes of God, both of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.
hmr: Chun, aisâna ṭhe an na, chi dân dang dangin, Ithamar naupasalhai le Eleazar naupasalhai laia chun Pathien in hotuhai le hmun inthienga hotuhai chu an um ve ve sih a.

en: And Shemaiah the son of Nethanel the scribe, who was of the Levites, wrote them in the presence of the king, and the princes, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and of the Levites; one fathers’ house being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.
hmr: Chun, Nethanel naupa ziektu Semaia chun lal le, rorêltuhai le, thiempu Zadok le, Abiathar naupa Ahimelek le, Levi mihai le thiempu chihai pahnam luhai hmaa chun a ziek a; Eleazar ta dingin pahnam khat chan chu a tlu a; Ithamar ta dingin pahnam khat chan chu a tlu bawk a.

en: Now the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
hmr: Chun, aisâna pakhatna chu Jehoiarib chungah a tlah a, a pahnina Jedaia chungah,

en: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
hmr: a pathumna Harim chungah, a palina Seorim chungah;

en: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
hmr: a pangana Malkija chungah, a parukna Mijamin chungah,

en: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
hmr: a pasarina Hakkoz chungah, a parietna Abija chungah,

en: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,
hmr: a pakuona Jeshua chungah, a sâwmna Sekania chungah;

en: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
hmr: A sâwmpakhatna Eliasib chungah, a sâwmpahnina Jakim chungah.

en: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
hmr: A sâwmpathumna Huppa chungah, a sâwmpalina Jesebeab chungah,

en: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
hmr: A sâwmpangana Bilga chungah a sâwmparukna Immer chungah;

en: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,
hmr: A sâwmpasarina Hezir chung- ah, a sâwmparietna Happizzez chungah.

en: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,
hmr: A sâwmpakuona Pethahia chungah, a sâwmhnina Jehezekel chungah,

en: the one and twentieth to Jachin, the two and twentieth to Gamul,
hmr: a sâwmhni pakhatna Jakin chungah, a sâwmhni pahnina Gamul chungah;

en: the three and twentieth to Delaiah, the four and twentieth to Maaziah.
hmr: A sâwmhni pathumna Delaia chungah, a sâwmhni palina Maazia chungah,

en: This was the ordering of them in their service, to come into the house of Jehovah according to the ordinance given unto them by Aaron their father, as Jehovah, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
hmr: LALPA Israelhai Pathienin ama thu a pêk anga, an thlatu Aron hmanga dân a pêk ang taka, LALPA ina rawngbâwl dinga an hung dân dinga, an rawngbâwlnaa an indawt dân chu a nih.

en: And of the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
hmr: Chun, Levi naupasal danghai chungthua chu: Amram naupasalhai laiah Subael, Subael naupasalhai laiah Jedeia,

en: Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.
hmr: Rehabia thlaah: Rehabia nau- pasalhai laiah Issia a hotu.

en: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
hmr: Izhar mia chun Selomoth; Selomoth naupasalhai laia chun Jahath.

en: And the sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
hmr: Chun, Hebron naupasalhaia chun: a hotu tak Jeria, a pa- hnina chu Amaria, a pathumna chu Jahaziel, a palina chu Jeka- meam.

en: The sons of Uzziel, Micah; of the sons of Micah, Shamir.
hmr: Uzziel naupasalhaia chun Mika; Mika naupasalhaia chun Samir.

en: The brother of Micah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
hmr: Mika unaupa chu Issia; Issia naupasalhaia chun Zekaria.

en: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah: Beno.
hmr: Merari naupasalhai chu Mahli le Musi; Jaazia naupasalhaia chun Beno;

en: The sons of Merari: of Jaaziah, Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.
hmr: Merari naupasala Jaazia nau- pasalhai chu: Beno, Soham, Zakkur le Ibri.

en: Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
hmr: Mahli naupasal chu: Eleazar, naupasal hrim neilo chu.

en: Of Kish; the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.
hmr: Kis naupasal chu: Jerahmeel.

en: And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after their fathers’ houses.
hmr: Chun, Musi naupasalhai chu: Mahli, Eder le Jerimoth. An pahnam ang peia Levi naupasalhai laia lusahai chu hienghai hi an nih.

en: These likewise cast lots even as their brethren the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and of the Levites; the fathers’ houses of the chief even as those of his younger brother.
hmr: Hieng hai khawm hin an unau Aron naupasalhai ang bawkin, lal David, Zadok, Ahimelek, Levi mihai le thiempu pahnam luhai hmaah, an unau naupang lemhai le thlatuhai khawm inthuruolin ai chu sân a ni veh a.

en: Moreover David and the captains of the host set apart for the service certain of the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals: and the number of them that did the work according to their service was:
hmr: Chunawa khawm David le sipai hotuhai chun dârbenthek le, perkhuong le ṭingṭanghai le thu hril duol duola rawngbâwltu dingin Jeduthun le Heman le Asaph nau- pasalhai chu an ṭheh a; chun, an rawngbâwlna ang peia chuong sin- thawhai sinthawtuhai nizât chu hi hi a nih:

en: of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asharelah, the sons of Asaph, under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied after the order of the king.
hmr: Asaph naupasalhai chu: Zakkur, Josef, Nethania le Asarela hai hi Asaph naupasalhai chu an nih, lal thupêk anga Asaph hnuoia thuhril- tuhai chu.

en: Of Jeduthun; the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun with the harp, who prophesied in giving thanks and praising Jehovah.
hmr: Jeduthun pâwl chu, Jeduthun naupasalhai chu Gedalia, Zeri, Jesaia, Simei, Hasabia le Mattithia hai, paruk hi an pa Jeduthun rawia ṭingṭang le LALPA chu inpâka lâwmthu hriltuhai chu an nih.

en: Of Heman; the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
hmr: Heman pâwl chu: Heman nau- pasalhai chu: Bukkia, Mattania, Uzziel, Sebuel, Jerimoth, Hanania, Hanani, Eliatha, Giddalti, Romamti- ezer, Josbekasa, Mallothi, Hothir le Mahazioth hai an na;

en: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
hmr: hienghai po po hi Pathien thua saki mûta lal zâwlnei Heman nau- pasalhai an nih. Pathien chun Heman chu naupasal sâwmpali le naunuhmei pathum a pêk a.

en: All these were under the hands of their father for song in the house of Jehovah, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the service of the house of God; Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman being under the order of the king.
hmr: Hienghai po po hi Pathien ina rawngbâwlnaa, ṭingṭanghai le dâr- benthekhai le perkhuonghai le LALPA ina hla pâwl dinga an pa hnuoia um an nih; Asaph hai, Jedu- thun hai, Heman hai chu lal thuhnuoiah an um sih a.

en: And the number of them, with their brethren that were instructed in singing unto Jehovah, even all that were skilful, was two hundred fourscore and eight.
hmr: Chun, anni le an unauhai LAL- PA ta dinga hla sak dinga inchûk- tira uma, sak thiem tahai nizât chu za hni sâwmriet pariet an nih.

en: And they cast lots for their offices, all alike, as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.
hmr: Chun, a chîn ni leh, a lien ni leh, inchûktirtu le inchûktu khawm, angkhat vawngin, an thil thaw ding chu aisânin an en hlak a.

en: Now the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph: the second to Gedaliah; he and his brethren and sons were twelve:
hmr: Asaph ta dinga aisân pakhatna chu Josef chungah a tluh a; a pahnina chu Gedalia chungah; ama le a unauhai le a naupasalhai leh sâwm pahni an nih:

en: the third to Zaccur, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a pathumna chu Zakkur chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih.

en: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a palina chu Izri chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai le chun sâwmpahni an nih;

en: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a pangana chu Nethania chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai chu sâwmpahni an nih;

en: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a parukna chu Bukkia chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih:

en: the seventh to Jesharelah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a pasarina chu Jesarela chung- ah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a parietna chu Jesaia chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a pakuona chu Mattania chung- ah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmna chu Simei chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmpakhatna chu Azarel chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmpahnina chu Hasabia chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmpathumna chu Subael chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmpalina chu Mattithia chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmpangana chu Jeremoth chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmparukna chu Hanania chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmpasarina chu Josbekasa chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmparietna chu Hanani chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmpakuona chu Mallothi chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmhnina chu Eliatha chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the one and twentieth to Hothir, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmhni pakhatna chu Hothir chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the two and twentieth to Giddalti, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: sâwmhni pahnina chu Giddalti chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the three and twentieth to Mahazioth, his sons and his brethren, twelve:
hmr: a sâwmhni pathumna chu Mahazioth chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih;

en: for the four and twentieth to Romamtiezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.
hmr: a sâwmhni palina chu Romam- ti-ezer chungah, a naupasalhai le a unauhai leh sâwmpahni an nih.

en: For the courses of the doorkeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
hmr: Kawtkhâr vêngtuhai pâwl ṭhea chun: Kora mihai chu: Kore naupa Meselemia le Asaph naupasalhai laia mi chu.

en: And Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the first-born, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
hmr: Meselemia chun naupasalhai a nei a, nâulutîr chu Zekaria, a pa- hnina Jediael, a pathumna Zebadia, a palina Jathniel;

en: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
hmr: a pangana Elam, a parukna Jehohanan, a pasarina Eliehoenai.

en: And Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the first-born, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethanel the fifth,
hmr: Chun, Obed-edom chun nau- pasalhai a nei a; nau lutîr chu Semaia a na, a pahnina chu Jehozabad, a pathumna chu Joa, a palina chu Sakar, a pangana chu Nethanel;

en: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.
hmr: a parukna chu Ammiel, a pasa- rina chu Issakar, a parietna chu Peullethai; Pathienin ama chu mal a sâwm sih a.

en: Also unto Shemaiah his son were sons born, that ruled over the house of their father; for they were mighty men of valor.
hmr: A naupa Semaia chun naupasal- hai an pahnamhai chunga rorêltuhai chu an pieng a; anni chu mi hrât khawkhêng ruok an ni sih a.

en: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad, whose brethren were valiant men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
hmr: Semaia naupasalhai chu: Othni le, Rephael le, Obed le, Elzabad, a unauhai chu mi hrât khawkhêng an nih; Elihu le Semakia hi.

en: All these were of the sons of Obed-edom: they and their sons and their brethren, able men in strength for the service; threescore and two of Obed-edom.
hmr: Hienghai po po hi Obed-edom naupasalhai thlahai chu an nih, anni le, an naupasalhai le an unauhai khawm mi hrât, rawngbâwlnaa thil- thawtheitak ruok sâwmruk pahni, Obed-edom thlahai an nih.

en: And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, valiant men, eighteen.
hmr: Chun, Meselemia khawmin unauhai le naupasal mi hrâttak, sâwmpariet a nei bawk a.

en: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the first-born, yet his father made him chief),
hmr: Hosa, Merari thlaa mi khawm chun naupasalhai a nei a; a hotu tak chu Simri a nih (nau lutîr a ni nawh a chu a pa chun hotu takah a siem a nih),

en: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
hmr: a pahnina chu Hilkia, a pa- thumna chu Tebalia, a palina chu Zekaria; Hosa unauhai le naupasal- hai po po chu an rêngin sâwmpathum an nih.

en: Of these were the courses of the doorkeepers, even of the chief men, having offices like their brethren, to minister in the house of Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA ina rawngbâwl dinga, an unauhai anga chanpuol nei ve, hotu takhai, kawtkhâr vêngtuhai pâwl chu hienghai hi an nih.

en: And they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to their fathers’ houses, for every gate.
hmr: Dai kawtkhâr tina ding chun, an pahnam dungzui peiin, a chîn le lien ni leh ai an sân pei a.

en: And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a discreet counsellor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
hmr: Chun, saktieng panga dinga aisânna chu Selemia chungah a tluh a. A naupa Zekaria, remruottu vartak ta ding chun ai an sân a; a aisânna chu hmârtieng pang dingin a tluh a.

en: To Obed-edom southward; and to his sons the store-house.
hmr: Obed-edom ta ding chun simtieng pang a tluh a, a naupasalhai ta dingin, thil siekhâwmna in chu a tluh a.

en: To Shuppim and Hosah westward, by the gate of Shallecheth, at the causeway that goeth up, watch against watch.
hmr: Suppim le Hosa ta ding chun thlangtieng pang a tluh a, Salleketh dai kawtkhâra inthawka intlar peia lam fe peia khan.

en: Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and for the store-house two and two.
hmr: Saktieng panga chun Levi mi paruk an na, hmârtieng ni khatah pali, simtieng ni khatah pali, chun, thil siekhâwmna in ta dingin, pahni peiin.

en: For Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.
hmr: Thlangtieng panga Parbar ta dingin a lampuiah pali, a Parbar hmunah pahni.

en: These were the courses of the doorkeepers; of the sons of the Korahites, and of the sons of Merari.
hmr: Hienghai hi kawtkhâr vêngtu- hai Kora mihai le Merari mihai thlahai pâwlhai chu an nih.

en: And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
hmr: Chun, Levi mihaia chun, Ahija chu Pathien ina rohai chunga le, thil inhlân tahaia rohai ta dinga enkawltu a nih,

en: The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the fathers’ houses belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
hmr: Ladan naupasalhai: Ladana inthawka Gerson thlahai, Gerson mi Ladan kuoma ṭhang pahnamhai luhai chu: Jehieli.

en: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham, and Joel his brother, over the treasures of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Jehieli naupasalhai chu: Zetham, a unaupa Joel leh, LALPA in ro siena in chunga hotu an nih.

en: Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, of the Uzzielites:
hmr: Amram miah, Izhar miah, Hebron miah, Uzziel miah:

en: and Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler over the treasures.
hmr: Mosie naupa, Gersom naupa Sebuel chu sum siekhâwmna chunga rorêltu a nih.

en: And his brethren: of Eliezer came Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomoth his son.
hmr: A unauhai: Eliezer naupa Rehabia, a naupa Jesaia, a naupa Joram, a naupa Zikri le a naupa Selomoth hai an nih.

en: This Shelomoth and his brethren were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the heads of the fathers’ houses, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the host, had dedicated.
hmr: Hi Selomoth le a unauhai chu, thilinhlân, lal David le pahnam luhai le, sâng khat chunga hotuhai le za khat chunga sipai hotuhaiin an in- hlânhai po po siekhâwmnahai chunga enkawltuhai an nih.

en: Out of the spoil won in battles did they dedicate to repair the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Indonahai hnênahaia râllâk thilhai chu LALPA in siemṭhatna ding chun an pêk a.

en: And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, had dedicated, whosoever had dedicated anything, it was under the hand of Shelomoth, and of his brethren.
hmr: Chuong zâwlnei Samuel hai, Kis naupa Saula hai, Nera naupa Abner hai, Zeruia naupa Joab haiin an hlânthienghai le, mi tukhawma thil an hung pêkhai chu Selomoth le a unauhai kuta chun a um vawng a.

en: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.
hmr: Izhar mihaia chun, Kenania le a naupasalhai chu Israel ram ta dinga puotienga sinthawnahaia hotuhai le rorêltuhai an nih.

en: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valor, a thousand and seven hundred, had the oversight of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the business of Jehovah, and for the service of the king.
hmr: Hebron mihaia chun, Hasabia le a unauhai chu, mi huoisen ṭhieu, sâng khat le za sari chu Jordan râl, thlangtienga Israel rama lal ta dinga rawngbâwlnaahai le, LALPA sin- thawnahai po po chunga enkawltuhai an nih.

en: Of the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers’ houses. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead.
hmr: Hebron mihaia chun, Jerija pahnam inthla dân anga Hebron mi chu a hotu a nih. David rorêl a kum sâwmlinaa chun nasataka zawng an na, Gileada Jazera chun mi hrât khawkhêng anni laia chun hmu suok an na.

en: And his brethren, men of valor, were two thousand and seven hundred, heads of fathers’ houses, whom king David made overseers over the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of the Manassites, for every matter pertaining to God, and for the affairs of the king.
hmr: Chun, a unau mi hrât khaw- khênghai chu sâng hni le za sari an na; anni chu lal David chun an pahnam luhai chu, lal chungthua le Pathien thil chungthu tinrêngah Reuben mihai, Gad mihai le Manasse hnam zâtvehai enkawltuhaia a siem an nih.

en: Now the children of Israel after their number, to wit, the heads of fathers’ houses and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers that served the king, in any matter of the courses which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year—of every course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai an nizât chu kum khat sûng thla po poa, thla tina fe suok a, hung lût pâwlhai, thil iengkima lal rawngbâwl hlakhai, hotuhai le, za khat le sâng khat chunga hotuhai le an pahnam luhai po po le chun, pâwl tina chun sîng hni le sâng li an na.

en: Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: Thla hmasataka pâwl hmasa- taka hotu ding chun Jasobeam, Zabdiel naupa a na, a pâwl chu sîng hni le sâng li an nih.

en: He was of the children of Perez, the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
hmr: Perez thlaa mi a na, thla hmasataka dinga sipai pâwl hotuhai po po laia hotu tak a nih.

en: And over the course of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite, and his course; and Mikloth the ruler: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: Chun, a thla hnina pâwla chun Aho mi Dodai chu a hotu a na, a pâwl chu: Mikloth chu rorêltu a na, a pâwl- a chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a nih.

en: The third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, chief: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: Thla thumna dinga sipai hotu pathumna chu Benaia a na, thiempu Jehoiada naupa, hotu chu a nih; chun, a pâwl chu sîng hni le sâng li an nih.

en: This is that Benaiah, who was the mighty man of the thirty, and over the thirty: and of his course was Ammizabad his son.
hmr: Hi Benaia hi, mi sâwmthum thilthawtheitakhai laia mi kha a nih; ama chu sâwmthumhai hotu kha a na, ama pâwl lai chun a naupa Ammizabad kha a ṭhang veh a.

en: The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla linaa dinga sipai hotu palina chu Joab unaupa Asahel kha a na, a naupa Zebadia khan a ai a aw a nih; chun, ama pâwla khawm chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla ngana dinga sipai hotu chu Izhar mi Samhuth a nih; ama pâwla chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla rukna dinga sipai hotu parukna chu Teko mi Ikkes naupa Ira a na, a pâwla chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla sarina dinga sipai hotu pasarina chu Ephraim thlaa mi Pelon mi Helez chu a na, a pâwla chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla rietna dinga sipai hotu parietna chu Zera hnama Husath mi Sibbekai kha a na; a pâwla chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla kuona dinga sipai hotu pakuona chu Benjamin thlaa mi Anathoth mi Abiezer a na, a pâwl a chun chu sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zerahites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla sâwmna dinga sipai hotu sâwmna chu Zera thlaa mi, Neto- phath mi, Maharai a na, a pâwla chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla sâwm pakhatna dinga sipai hotu sâwm pakhatna chu Ephraim thlaa mi Pirathon mi Benaia a na, a pâwla chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
hmr: A thla sâwm pahnina dinga sipai hotu sâwm pahnina chu, Othniel naupa Netophath mi Heldai a na, a pâwla chun sîng hni le sâng li an um a.

en: Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri the ruler: of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maacah:
hmr: Chunawa khawm chun Israel hnamhai chunga chun, Reuben mihai laia rorêltu chu Zikri naupa Eliezer a na; Simeon mihai laia chun Maaka naupa Sephatia a na;

en: of Levi, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel: of Aaron, Zadok:
hmr: Levi mihai laia chun Kemuel naupa Hasabia a na; Arnon thla lai Zadok;

en: of Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David: of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael:
hmr: Juda thla lai David unauhai laia pakhat Elihu chu; Issakar hnam lai Mikael naupa Omri;

en: of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah: of Naphtali, Jeremoth the son of Azriel:
hmr: Zebulun hnamah Obadia naupa Ismaia; Naphtali hnamah Azriel naupa Jerimoth;

en: of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah: of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah:
hmr: Ephraim thlahai laia chu Azazia naupa Hosea; Manasse hnam zâtvea chun Pedaia naupa Joel;

en: of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah: of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner:
hmr: Gilead rama Manasse hnam zâtve laiah Zekaria naupa Iddo, Benjamin thla laiah Abner naupa Jaasiel;

en: of Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the captains of the tribes of Israel.
hmr: Dan hnamah Jeroham naupa Azarel. Hienghai hi Israel hnam laia hotuhai chu an nih.

en: But David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under, because Jehovah had said he would increase Israel like to the stars of heaven.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, David chun kum sâwmhni le a hnuoi tieng chu an nizât a lâk nawh a; LALPA chun Israel chu vâna arasi zâtin a sukpung ding a nih ti a lo hril ta lei khan.

en: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number, but finished not; and there came wrath for this upon Israel; neither was the number put into the account in the chronicles of king David.
hmr: Zeruia naupa Joab chun tiem chu a tiem ngei a, nisienlakhawm, a zo nawh a; hi hi lei hin Israel chunga chun lunginsenna a tlung nghe nghe a; chun, lal David chanchin ziekna lekhabua chun chu nizât chu sielût a ni bawk nawh a.

en: And over the king’s treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the treasures in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the castles, was Jonathan the son of Uzziah:
hmr: Chun, lal sum siekhâwmna in chunga chun Adiel naupa Azmaveth chu hotu a na; hmun danga le, khawpuiahai le, khawperhaia sum siekhâwmna le, kulbîngahai Uzzia naupa Jonathan chu hotu a na;

en: and over them that did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub:
hmr: chun, thil chîngna dinga lo inletnaa sin thawtuhai chunga chun Kelub naupa Ezri chu hotu a na;

en: and over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite: and over the increase of the vineyards for the wine-cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite:
hmr: grêp huon chungahai chun Ramath mi Simei chu a nih; uoin siekhâwmna khur dinga grêp huon zau pei thua chun Shipham mi Zabdi chu a hotu a nih;

en: and over the olive-trees and the sycomore-trees that were in the lowland was Baal-hanan the Gederite: and over the cellars of oil was Joash:
hmr: chun, ram phaitienga theichang kûnghai le oliv thinghai chunga chun Geder mi Baal-hanan chu a na; hriek siena khurhai chunga chun Joas a na;

en: and over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:
hmr: chun, Sarona bâwng ruol tlahai chunga chun Saron mi Sitrai a nih; chun, phairuoma bâwng ruol tlahai chunga chun Adlai naupa Saphat chu hotu a nih;

en: and over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite: and over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagrite.
hmr: sanghâwngsei chunga chun Ismael mi Obil chu hotu a nih; sa- bengtunghai chunga chun Meronoth mi Jedeia hotu a na;

en: All these were the rulers of the substance which was king David’s.
hmr: berâm ruol chunga chun Hagar mi Jaziz chu hotu a nih; Hienghai po po hi lal David thuomhnaw chunga rorêltuhai chu an nih.

en: Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counsellor, a man of understanding, and a scribe: and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons:
hmr: David pami Jonathan chu rorêltu a na, ama chu mi hrietna nei, lekhaziektu a nih; chun, Hakmoni naupa, Jehiel chu lal naupasalhai inchûktirtu a na;

en: and Ahithophel was the king’s counsellor: and Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend:
hmr: Ahitophel chu lal remruotpuitu a na, Ark mi Husai chu lal ruolpa a nih;

en: and after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar: and the captain of the king’s host was Joab.
hmr: Ahitophel zoa chun, Benaia naupa Jehoiada a na, Abiathar leh; chun, lal sipaihai hotu chu Joab a nih.

en: And David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the companies that served the king by course, and the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, and the rulers over all the substance and possessions of the king and of his sons, with the officers, and the mighty men, even all the mighty men of valor, unto Jerusalem.
hmr: Lal David chun Israel lal po pohai, hnam tina luhai, a pâwl pâwla lal sinthawtuhai hotuhai, sipai sâng khat pâwl chunga hotuhai, za khat pâwl chunga hotuhai, a naupa- salhai le lal thilnei le thuomhnaw po po chunga rorêltuhai le, mi lienhai le, mi huoisen, mi hrât khawkhênghai po po chu Jerusalema chun a ko khâwm vawng a.

en: Then David the king stood up upon his feet, and said, Hear me, my brethren, and my people: as for me, it was in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, and for the footstool of our God; and I had made ready for the building.
hmr: Chun, lal David chu a kein a ngîr a, “Ka unauhai, ka mihai, lo ngai ta u; keia ngaia chun LALPA thuthlungna bâwm châwlna ding in le, Pathien ke innghatna ding hmun bâwlpêk chu ka lungrilah a um a; chuongchun, a in bâwlna ding khawm chu ka siem zo hieu tah a.

en: But God said unto me, Thou shalt not build a house for my name, because thou art a man of war, and hast shed blood.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathien chun, ‘Nang chun ka in bâwl naw ti nih, indo mi i na, thisen însuo hlak leiin,’ a ta.

en: Howbeit Jehovah, the God of Israel, chose me out of all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever: for he hath chosen Judah to be prince; and in the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel;
hmr: Ngai ta u, LALPA Israel Pathien chun kumkhuoa Israelhai chunga lala um dingin ka thlatuhai thla laia inthawk chun a mi thlang suok a; ka thlatu sûngkuoah, Juda sûngkuoa chun, Juda chu hotu ni dingin a thlang ta sih a; chuongchun, ka pa naupasalhai laia chun Israel po po chunga lala mi siem chu ṭha a ti zâwng tak a ni tah a;

en: and of all my sons (for Jehovah hath given me many sons), he hath chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of Jehovah over Israel.
hmr: chun, ka naupasalhai po laiah (LALPA chun naupasal tamtak a mi pêk sih a), Israel chunga LALPA rama lalṭhungphaa ṭhung dingin ka naupa Solomon chu a thlang tah a.

en: And he said unto me, Solomon thy son, he shall build my house and my courts; for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
hmr: Chun, ka kuomah a hril a, ‘I naupa Solomon hin ka in le ka tuollai sûng chu bâwl a tih, ama chu ka naupa ni dingin ka thlang tah a, kei khawm a pa nîng ka tih.

en: And I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do my commandments and mine ordinances, as at this day.
hmr: Chun, a ram khawm chu kum- khawtluongin sukdet ka tih, tulai hun anga ka rorêlhai le ka thupêkhai thaw dinga a pawm zing chun,’ tiin.

en: Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of Jehovah, and in the audience of our God, observe and seek out all the commandments of Jehovah your God; that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children after you for ever.
hmr: “Chuleiin, tuhin, LALPA mipui inkhâwm Israelhai mithmua le ei Pathien hrietna hin, hi ram ṭhatak hi in nei thei a, kumkhuoa dinga in thlahai kuoma rochan ni dinga in mâksanpêk theina dingin LALPA in Pathien thupêkhai po po chu zawng suok unla, zâwm ro.

en: And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind; for Jehovah searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts. If thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever.
hmr: Chun, nang ka naupa Solomon, i thlatuhai Pathien chu hre la, lungril inhâwktak le lungril tlûntakin ama rawng chu bâwl rawh; LALPA chun lungril sûng po po chu a zawng suok hlak a, lungrila tumhai khawm chu a hriet hlak sih a; ama chu i zawng chun, i hmuah um ngei a ta; amiruok- chu, ama chu i nghatsan chun, ama khawmin kumkhuoa dingin pei thla vêng a ti che.

en: Take heed now; for Jehovah hath chosen thee to build a house for the sanctuary: be strong, and do it.
hmr: Tuhin fîmkhur la; hmun in- thieng ta dinga in bâwl dingin LALPA chun a ruot ta si cheh a; insukhrât la thaw nghâl rawh,” tiin.

en: Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch of the temple, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper rooms thereof, and of the inner chambers thereof, and of the place of the mercy-seat;
hmr: Chun, David chun a naupa Solomon kuoma chun biek in tuolpûk lim le chutaka a in le, a sum sie- khâwmna in le, chutaka a pindan chunghnunghai le, a pindan sûngril- hai le, zângaina ṭhungpha hmun dinghai lim chu a pêk a;

en: and the pattern of all that he had by the Spirit, for the courts of the house of Jehovah, and for all the chambers round about, for the treasuries of the house of God, and for the treasuries of the dedicated things;
hmr: a lungrila a lo hmu ta ang chun: LALPA in tuolsûng tuollai inhuonna dâm, a vêl pindan po po lim dâm, Pathien ina sum siekhâwmna in lim dâm, thilser siekhâwmna in lim dâm chu a pêk a;

en: also for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of Jehovah, and for all the vessels of service in the house of Jehovah;
hmr: thiempuhai le Levi mihai a pâwl pâwla an umna ding hmun lim dâm, Lalpa ina dinga bûr le bêl po po hai lim dâm,

en: of gold by weight for the vessels of gold, for all vessels of every kind of service; of silver for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;
hmr: rawngbâwlna ding bûr le bêl chi tin, rângkachak bûr le bêl ding, rângkachak hmang zât ding,

en: by weight also for the candlesticks of gold, and for the lamps thereof, of gold, by weight for every candlestick and for the lamps thereof; and for the candlesticks of silver, silver by weight for every candlestick and for the lamps thereof, according to the use of every candlestick;
hmr: rângkachak khâwnvar siena le a khâwnvar ding rângkachak hmang zât ding le, a sathâu khâwnvar siena le chutaka a khâwnvar ta ding chun rângkachak a bûka bûkin a pêk a; tangkaruo khawm tangkaraw sathâu khâwnvar siena dingin le a khâwnvar siena tin bûkzie ang pei chun a pêk a;

en: and the gold by weight for the tables of showbread, for every table; and silver for the tables of silver;
hmr: chun, entirna bei siena dinga dawkân dingin rângkachak, dawkân tin ta dingin; chun, tangkaraw daw- kân ta dingin tangkaruo;

en: and the flesh-hooks, and the basins, and the cups, of pure gold; and for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl; and for the silver bowls by weight for every bowl;
hmr: sa kuoikimhai le, châwtawlhai le nohai chu, rângkachak inthieng: rângkachak maihûn ding chun mai- hûn tin chu a bûk ang peiin, tang- karaw maihûn ding chun maihûn tin a bûk ang peiin;

en: and for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the chariot, even the cherubim, that spread out their wings, and covered the ark of the covenant of Jehovah.
hmr: chun, riminhnik râwna mâi- châma ding chun rângkachak suk- thieng a bûka bûkin, chun, cherubhai LALPA thuthlungna bâwm an thlahai zâra inkhumtuhai tawlailîr lima dinga chun rângkachak a pêk bawk a.

en: All this, said David, have I been made to understand in writing from the hand of Jehovah, even all the works of this pattern.
hmr: David chun, “Hieng po po hi LALPA chun keima chungah ama kut ngeia ziekin a mîn hriettir a nih, hi riruongna sin po pohai hi,” a tih a.

en: And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed; for Jehovah God, even my God, is with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until all the work for the service of the house of Jehovah be finished.
hmr: Chun, David chun a naupa Solomon kuoma chun, “Insukhrât la, insukhuoi la, thaw el rawh; ṭi naw la, beidawng bawk naw rawh; LALPA Pathien, ka Pathien ngei chu i kuomah a um sih a; LALPA ina rawngbâwlna sin po pohai chu zo a ni vawng hmakhat chun inhlawsamtir naw ni cheh a, nghatsan bawk naw ni che.

en: And, behold, there are the courses of the priests and the Levites, for all the service of the house of God: and there shall be with thee in all manner of work every willing man that hath skill, for any manner of service: also the captains and all the people will be wholly at thy commandment.
hmr: Chun, ngai ta, Pathien ina rawngbâwlna po poa dingin Levi mihai le thiempuhai chu pâwl an um a; sin kawng chi tinrênga ding chun mi themthiem inhâwktak takhai i kuomah um an ta, rawngbâwlna kawng tinrênga ding chun; mipuihai hotuhai po po khawm chu i thu thuin an um ding a nih,” a ta.
